boardgame.name: Stormworks: Search and Destroy
boardgame.description:
Conquest mode was added with the addition of the first paid DLC. This mode can be activated in the creation menu, and can be combined with career or creative mode. This adds the ability to weaponize vehicles, and a more combat oriented experience, alongside the rescue missions. The DLC added both player held and vehicle mounted weapons, like autocannons and machine guns.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stormworks%3A_Build_and_Rescue Stormworks: Build and Rescue]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: El Ojo de Myrkul
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Últimamente a Eric no se le ha visto demasiado por los Reinos Superiores, pero volvió a la superficie a tiempo para contarnos este vistazo al Estero de los Hombres Muertos.

User summary:

This is an apocryphal, Spanish-language translation of Eye of Myrkul.

boardgame.name: 20 Dias para Morir
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Queridos ciudadanos:

La situacion actual nos lleva a esto, es del conosimiento publico que la ciudad esta siendo atacada, ademas los sabios han descubierto que una peste, no conosida por ninguno de los sabios de la ciudad, nos ha atacado a todos.

Debido a esto se esta organizando una partida para realizar un viaje al templo de la naturaleza donde se pedira a los clerigos de aquel lugar que nos ayuden con alguna cura. Los interazados dirijanse al templo de la ciudad mañana al medio dia. Duque de rulfo

boardgame.name: El Dios Oscuro
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

La ciudad amurallada de Hanghara, en el sur del desierto de Humbhat, fue una vez un centro de comercio, el punto de reunión para rutas de caravanas procedentes del este y del oeste. Pero ahora las caravanas pasan de largo. Las alegrías y las riquezas del pasado no son más que una página en la historia. Los muros de la ciudad son presa del tiempo y de la indiferencia. La mayoría de los habitantes se han trasladado a otras ciudades más vivas. Y todo esto ha llegado a este punto porque durante la noche, en la ciudad de Hanghara desaparece una cantidad ingente de transeúntes, desde borrachos hasta amantes, desde juerguistas hasta ladrones.

boardgame.name: Just One: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A pack of 5 new words for Just One, chosen by Dice Tower fans!

listing.notes:

boardgame.name: Doce
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hay una banda de ladrones que opera desde hace poco en la zona de Stallanford, un pequeño pueblito al borde del río Shuttrugal, al norte del ducado de Karameikos, en el mundo de Mystara . Hasta ahora las dos partidas enviadas contra ellos fracasaron.

Se les encomendará a nuestro grupo la tarea de desbaratar esta banda, cuyo escondite se desconoce. Les ofrece 2000 piezas de oro c/u.

boardgame.name: El Claro de la Media Luna
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Modulo pensado para jugadores que no sean muy expertos en ninguna habilidad, entre tres y seis, y que no dispongan de una magia excepcionalmente exagerada. Todas las notas escritas en negrita son solamente para el director. Durante todo el modulo no aparecerá ninguna indicación de las tiradas de habilidades a realizar, eso queda a elección del director, así mismo tampoco aparece ninguna característica de los personajes no jugadores, dejando al director la labor de crearlos, si lo desea, a raíz del grupo que este jugando el modulo, con la única indicación de que los nombres con doble subrayados son personajes excepcionalmente hábiles en lo que a su profesión se requiere, y aquellos que están subrayados simplemente son personajes muy buenos en lo que hacen. Este no es un modulo para directores iniciales, ya que el final de la aventura recae totalmente sobre sus hombros.

boardgame.name: Visita al Recolector
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“Se requiere grupo de aventureros sin importar nivel para realizar transacci¢n comercial. Emolumentos a convenir. Interesados s¡rvanse en dirigirse a la noble morada del mago Brothenor en la £ltima casa de la calle del contemplador.”

boardgame.name: Tras la Pista de los Sacerdotes Desaparecidos
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Aventura pensada para 3-6 jugadores de niveles 1-4 con 10 niveles en total. Se recomienda que la fuerza del grupo recaiga en los guerreros, ya que magos y cl‚ rigos van a estar seriamente imposibilitados de lanzar hechizos durante la aventura ya que esta transcurre en un  rea de magia salvaje.

boardgame.name: Fickle: Decree Rules Promo Cards

Each Decree Card uses the same icons to signal how the rule changes Set Up, Direct Action or Scoring for the entire game. Where the rule book conflicts with a Decree Card, follow the Decree Card instead.

Includes 3 double sided cards:
Rules Card / Family Feud
Alpha Player / Top 10
Hidden Ally / Race to the Bottom

boardgame.name: Panzer Strider
boardgame.description:
Miniatures agnostic skirmish game of mech on mech combat.

This is a game of mech combat in a science fantasy setting of battle and ambition. Of pirates and those of royal blood.

Any faction can fight any other faction it is assumed that the pirates will fight pirates when their ambitions do not align. And the noble's family’s will fight in petty conflicts for similar reasons.

You can design your own mechs and carrier then send them off to war. You need something to represent your forces. Model kits or LEGO are what I recommend. You will also need two sets of polyhedral dice and some paper for your character sheets. Last but not least: you will need a flat surface to play on. I also would recommend some books to use as terrain.

The game is won when you destroy or demobilize the opposing player's carrier or they do the same to yours.

In the future, I hope to introduce solo play and a campaign but for now let’s get to the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Die Geschichte beim Schopfe packen: SL-Eingriffe und Sondereffekte
boardgame.description:
This German language Numenera supplement combines the following English supplements:
- Taking the Narrative by the Tail: GM Intrusions & Special Effects
- Injecting the Weird
- In Strange Aeons: Lovecraftian Numenera

boardgame.name: Allies
boardgame.description:
Legend has it that long ago, Gah'dir the supreme mage forged a weapon known as the Scarlet Sword in order to form an alliance with Bashok the great orc king. By wielding the sword together, they created the most powerful alliance ever built among enemies and gained a power like no other. Since then, the sword has disappeared and reappeared many times over the years and it has determined the destiny of all nations time and time again.
Recently, the legendary Scarlet Sword was rediscovered, causing the most powerful leaders in all the land to seek out an ally and once again prepare for war.

In Allies, you will create and control a fantasy army by uniting two different factions of your choice. You can either use your cards to command your troops or deploy them onto the battlefield. The unique abilities of each faction can be combined to create many different synergies, so choose wisely.

Allies is a competitive two-player card game in which every move matters. It includes tactical and strategic components. Prepare your strategies well and don’t get distracted! Remember that your plans need to change constantly to anticipate your enemies’ movements as well as to disrupt them.

In the end, the army that gains control of the battlefield first claims victory!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Racing Hedgehogs
boardgame.description: Racing Hedgehogs is a strategic family game that requires prediction skills and a touch of cunning in order to win... Each player on their turn plays a card from their hand, which determines which hedgehog to move and how many steps to take. The race ends when the first hedgehog reaches the end of the track.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: COAL&GUNS! US ships 1885 - 1905
boardgame.description:
This volume contains “ship cards” for the rule set "COAL&GUNS!". In order to play with them you need the basic rulebook.

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Coal & Guns!: Tactical level naval rules for the pre-dreadnought era

boardgame.name: Dead Belt
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

You are alone out here.

But that’s the way we like it. Out here in the Dead Belt, surrounded by the carcasses of space-faring history ripe for plunder and picking, another heartbeat means enough time for someone else to give your justly prised and prized salvage the old hairy eyeball. That means trouble, and there’s enough of that out here as is.

Not everyone’s got the temperament to be a Belter. Plenty of folks crack when the grav cuts and the lights go off. Plenty more jump at shadows when their flash starts to flicker. Others are too busy watching their O2 to see opportunities. Some folks just don’t have the know-how to rig a three-channel override through the primary induction boot shroud to get to the juicy payday underneath. But that isn’t you. If you can only rely on your gear, your smarts, and your grit, you’re going to make a stack of cred out here among these hulks.

Or you’re going to die trying.

Either way, you’re going to do it alone. No one’s coming looking. No one knows you’re here.

Dead Belt is a solo strategy RPG. It’s about skillful and desperate scavengers picking over the remains of junked starships in hopes of a juicy payday.

You will need:


A deck of common playing cards.
Two six-sided dice (d6).
A few small tokens: one to represent your character, and three or four to mark trouble when it rears its head. You can use other dice, coins, or whatever you have laying around for tokens.
A printed (or drawn-out) character sheet, provided in the Player Kit.
Optional: A printed copy of Dead Belt for playing away from a device.


The core gameplay loop revolves around building a Belter and taking them out into the Belt to scavenge dead, randomly-generated starships. You’ll deal with all the dangers lurking onboard these starships, push your luck, and finally return to spend your hard-won booty to secure better equipment, improve your skills, pay down your crippling debt, and hopefully maybe eventually set yourself up to live out your dreams far from the Belt.

boardgame.name: Pokémon All Stars Get Everyone & Battle Game
boardgame.description:
Introducing a Pokémon board game base on the Nintendo Pokémon franchise that everyone can enjoy getting and battle. Player starts the game from the starting square and becomes a Pokémon Trainer (Boys&Girls). Roll the dice in order like "Sugoroku" and proceed while following the instructions to collect Pokémon, item cards and event cards.

Collect over 200 Pokémon and challenge the awaited rival(Cards)!!The player who challenges the awaited rival and defeats it first wins.

boardgame.name: LIve. Love. Die. Remember.
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Live. Love. Die. Remember. is a GMless RPG for 1 to 4 players about mechs falling in love with their pilots, reliving their memories of love before the end, and the cost of victory.

You each play as an AI enabled, humanoid, militarised, robot. A mech. You'll describe scenes that explore your mech’s memories as they are confronted with a choice during their final battle.

boardgame.name: Three Sisters: Weather Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Weather expansion uses the value of the highest undrafted die to create a weather-related condition that will apply to the next round of play. This means that while the first round of the game will play normally, every subsequent round will have a weather effect that will provide emergent tactical decisions and opportunities for you as you farm.

The weather expansion board sits above the game board and the cloud meeple is used to mark the weather condition that is in play for the round.

Includes: weather board plus cloud and tractor wooden tokens

Note: This was a KS Exclusive mini-expansion and was FREE to KS backers. It will not be included with retail copies of the game, but may be available directly from Motor City Gameworks in the future.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Eco Neighborhood
Еко Маало
boardgame.description:
In Eco Neighborhood the most important thing is building a clean environment, so moving through the streets you will have the opportunity to use different means of transport and find out their pros and cons, but be careful, you can get stuck in a traffic jam! On your way to the finish line, every time you step on the Eco Fact field you will find out new and interesting information about renewable energy sources, and why it’s important to wisely spend the electrical energy! Eco Neighborhood will show you where to move to find out the importance of protecting our environment and how you can contribute in protection of the Planet.

On the way to the finish line you will find out new things and challenges. Some of the fields will move you forward, but some will move you back. Also you will have the opportunity to invest you hard earned points in order to save energy through energy efficient light bulbs, energy efficient windows, solar panels and isolation for your home. The road to your goal is field with lots of interaction and fun.

Eco Neighborhood was created as a didactic material as part of the project “Education on energy”. The project was realized by Eco Logic, and was supported by the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC).

boardgame.name: Smile & Play
boardgame.description: The board game is intended for pupils from 5th to 9th grade, and it comprises of a platform with 11 examples of everyday locations toward which the children/teams have to go. On the way to the location, they resolve exercises and tasks for improving of the English language skills, through cards with activities, questions, fun facts – given by the mentor/teacher/parent that has the role of Game Guide/Maser.

boardgame.name: Behext
boardgame.description:
The more powerful the magic, the more danger in the wielding.
BEHEXT is a magical combat deck-building game, where your hand of spells is both your only defense and your only currency. To that end, you must sacrifice cards from your hand, and even your own willpower, to custom build your arcane arsenal.

Begin as one of 6 unique Battlemages specialized in their own magical discipline. Then, tailor your deck to your strategic tastes and in reaction to emerging opportunities. Curse and counter-curse your opponents into submission… without being Hexed yourself by the wild magics that have since passed beyond your control.

An unconventional deck-builder that is highly interactive as you constantly deflect Hexes around the table. You are not building a resource engine so much as constructing your deck to deliver the types of interactions you want to have with other players. Will you specialize in forcing discards to deprive them, focus on negation magic, attack their Willpower with direct damage – or take on chaotic and possibly dangerous spells to build Victory points into your deck at great risk to yourself?

Plus, newly conjured spells are not put into your discard pile, rather than forcing you to wait for their return, but are placed directly into your hand. You can play them immediately – right when you need them most.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ¿Seguro?
boardgame.description: ¿Seguro? is a party game in which you don't have to give the exact answer, a numerical answer, but you do have to guess the interval in which the answer is inserted. Whoever is within that range will earn points.

boardgame.name: Likes
boardgame.description:
Likes is a party game in which we will discover the tastes of others.

Do you think you know the people around you? Are you one of those people who see other people at first? Put it to the test!

In the Likes card game you will be able to see first-hand that people are never known as well as we like to believe. Try to guess the tastes and hobbies of other people through the images on the cards. At first everything will depend on your intuition, but little by little all people will become an open book for you. Of course the feeling will be reciprocal.

Likes is fun while we get to know each other!

boardgame.name: Bearithmatic
boardgame.description:
This set of beautifully illustrated cards with thirteen different animals set across the four seasons offers a range of educational matching and addition-based card games. Get all ages engaged, with breath taking scenery and cute critters from around the world.

Kick off with Bearithmatic to build the largest wildlife reserve, or enjoy one of the other four classic games included in the accompanying rulebook.

boardgame.name: Sailorman Dice
boardgame.description:
Sailorman Dice is a roll and write in which you compete against up to 50 opponents. Combine your dice rolls clever on your sheet to get the most points at the end of the game.

In Sailorman you roll dice in rounds. Everytime someone rolls you write down (one of the two) combination of a Symbol and a number onto your sheet. Sheets have different areas (grass, water, mountains, sand). You gain Points if you complete a row, column or area.

The first person who has 8 Completions triggers the end. All players count up and the one with the most points wins.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 20 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
Sailorman Dice - Würfelspiel Bereit, in hohe See zu stechen und die meisten Punkte einzufahren? Anker lichten! Beim spannenden Würfelspiel Sailorman Dice werden die Spieler*innen zu waschechten Seeleuten, die fette Beute machen wollen und dabei große Teile der Berge, Felder, des Strands und des Flusses einnehmen möchten. Dafür müssen sie geschickt ihre Würfelergebnisse auf der Landkarte eintragen und möglichst viele Gebiete auf dem Würfelblock füllen. Wer am Ende die meisten Punkte hat, gewinnt. Das Spiel eignet sich perfekt für den nächsten Spieleabend oder als Geschenk für Fans von Roll & Write-Spielen!
So wird’s gespielt: - Alle Spieler*innen erhalten eine Landkarte zum Ausfüllen. Nun wird im Uhrzeigersinn reihum mit allen vier Würfeln gewürfelt. - Die Würfelergebnisse müssen geschickt in die Reihen und Spalten der Landkarte eingetragen werden. - Dabei gilt: Die Symbole auf den Würfeln geben die Reihe vor und die Zahlen müssen von links nach rechts gleichbleiben oder aufsteigen. - Für jede ausgefüllte Reihe, Spalte und Gebietsfläche gibt es Punkte. - Wer die Zahlen am schlausten einträgt und viele Punkte sammelt, gewinnt.
Inhalt 2 Zahlenwürfel 2 Symbolwürfel 1 Block
https://youtu.be/zhZkXXaN7SQ
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

The game is new and still in shrink wrap!
I will ship from Germany and I am willing to ship anywhere.
Please ask me, for the shipping costs for your land.
I will charge shipping at cost. Everything will be well packed.
You can pay me through Paypal or bank transfer to my German bank account but any fees charged must be covered by you.
If you buy more games, then I make all in one package!
We have a large private collection of games. Due to space and time constraints we must rid ourselves of some of the games. Therefore, these are private sales.

boardgame.name: Game Builder Garage
boardgame.description:
In Game Builder Garage, the player uses a visual programming language centralized on the concept of creatures called Nodon. The Nodon represent various facets of input, game output, and game logic, such as a Stick Nodon that reports input from the Joy-Con analog stick or a Person Nodon that represents an on-screen character. The player builds a program by adding Nodon and making connections between the various nodes on Nodon, such as connecting the Stick Nodon to the Person Nodon as to tie the analog stick to movement of the character on-screen.[2] Nodon are available to interface nearly all features of the Switch and Joy-Con, including the infrared sensors and motion controls.

The game features a lesson mode to guide the player through using the Nodon language and to help them understand some of the principles of game development though a series of seven built-in games that the player can create.[2][3]

Games built within Game Builder Garage can support up to eight different Joy-Con, effectively allowing up to eight-player local multiplayer games to be built.[3]

Game Builder Garage has a share function, that allows creators to upload their games and share them with other people. However, it does not feature a game browser, but rather a code has to be shared by the creator for other people to access it. Fans of the game have been creating their own platforms for sharing their games; the most popular one being MyGarage Games.[4]

The game also allows for the use of commercial USB computer mice.[5]

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Skinchangers
boardgame.description:
Skinchangers have the rare ability to project their consciousness into nearby creatures, altering their behavior. This can be used simply, perhaps having them perform tricks. But it can also be used in combat. It’s bad enough when an enemy unit is advancing on your position. It’s worse when that unit is flanked by giant wolves or bears.

The Skinchangers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders a new option for their armies. The Skinchanger Unit Attachment can be placed in any unit, ignoring usual Unit Attachment rules (so they can join a unit with another attachment already in it). When being added, the player can also add their animal unit to the table. When the Skinchanger’s unit activates, the accompanying animal can activate immediately afterward, creating perfect “one-two punch” combinations. Just be sure that the two are never further than Long Range from one-another, or the Skinchanger is killed. Either situation will cause the animal to also be destroyed.

If you've ever played the classic game of "Signal", this is it but with a cat twist! This game is played in teams of pairs, involves a secret signal, and cat-astrophic mayhem to collect and complete their chosen cat set first! All in real-time!

boardgame.name: The Mole
boardgame.description:
The Mole is a hilarious, naughty, conversation-based game in which players use observation, bluff and cunning to win. The spies only have a few minutes to identify the mole in one of 16 secret, adult-only locations – from a porn film set to an organ-harvesting hospital – while the mole is only ever one incriminating answer away from blowing their cover. Can the mole guess the secret location and foil the plot? Or will the spies unmask the mole in time?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Momiji: Falling Leaves
boardgame.description:

The player with the highest visible number (1 or higher) on one of their leaf card piled takes the corresponding Falling Leaf token from the center of the table or from another player. If taken from the center, they may also refresh one of their personal Landscape Abilities.

Each Falling Leaf token is worth 5 points at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: FIVES
boardgame.description:
If You Can Count
You Can Play

Fast!! Fascinating!! Fun!!
A game for ages 5 to 105
2 to 6 persons may play

HOW TO PLAY: Shuffle deck. Deal four cards face up to each player. Turn one card face up in the center of the playing area and place the remaining pile face down next to it. The player to the left of the dealer begins by putting a card with the next numerical value on top of the card that was turned up. Only one card can be played. If the player does not have the right card, he picks a card from the face down pile. If he picks the right card, he must play it. If he picks the wrong card, he places it face up with his other cards. The player to his left then takes a turn. If the pile you pick from gets used up, play continues. Each player, in turn, must play the right card if he has it, or, pass if he does not have it. The first one to play all of his cards is the Game Winner. The deal is passed clockwise for succeeding games.

boardgame.name: Mindabar - The City of Malice
boardgame.description:
(Back Cover)

Welcome to Mindabar, the city of malice! Welcome, welcome dear wicked ones, to our beloved city of Mindabar! In this city, you are free to do anything you want! We are not limited by the laws or the morality of petty deities. We are free from it all!

Imagine how would you feel when there is no one to tell you what you can do, or no one to prevent you from doing what you want. This is how it feels like to live in Mindabar. Here, you can display your art no matter how unorthodox or grotesque it is. You can study your magic or focus on your academic work without any wizards guild to tell you that it is forbidden. You can eat, drink, and have fun to excess. You can even murder people for sport!

Just be careful not to disrespect our ever-powerful primordial being of destruction, Sabnock, and its prophet Aborath. They, and their Temple of Destruction are the true masters of our city. Still, have no fear, as long as you are respectful and devoted to their teachings, the only boundary for your life here exists in your imagination!

Mindabar is an evil-themed campaign setting for 5E. The setting consists of a giant city called Mindabar, a city that can appear in any realm, anywhere. It invites people who have pure wickedness in their hearts to fill its streets.

This campaign setting is suited for those who wish to play a campaign or adventure in an urban fantasy, for character parties of both good and evil. Evil characters can have the time of their lives here, as there are no laws, no boundaries, and no limits to wickedness in here. On the other hand, good characters can try to infiltrate or assault this gargantuan city, to try and destroy a dangerous primordial and its lich prophet.

boardgame.name: Variations on a Theme: Supplementary Rules for Monopoly
boardgame.description:
A collection of Monopoly variants, intended (except for the last) to be used separately:


The Investment Fund allows players to invest their money. The principal can never be taken out but every time a player passes GO they receive 10% interest. This can radically change the nature of the game, among other things speeding it up significantly.



The Auction Game requires all properties to be auctioned when landed on for the first time. This tends to slow the game down and reduces reliance on luck somewhat.



Building Past Hotels allows further property development. This makes the cheaper monopolies more interesting. A set of extended property cards is provided which show the additional costs and rents.



Ruffles and Flourishes, a set of small tweaks which can be used together or separately. One is a new set of "wahoo" cards which can all be kept until a player wants to use them; a set is provided.

boardgame.name: Momiji: Morning Dew
boardgame.description: Morning Dew allows you to play Momiji with up to 5 players. Morning Dew cards can also be added to a 1-4 player game in place of another leaf type. The blue Morning Dew leaf cards can be collected in their own pile in a player’s personal area as usual, or they can be played as Wild cards/Jokers. When played as Wild you can add it to the top of any color of leaf card following the usual rules. You can also play any color of leaf on top of a blue leaf. You cannot have two or more leaf cards of the same color visible on top of your piled at the end of your “play leaf cards” action, and you can never play a blue leaf onto a closed pole showing the Torii symbol. If used as a Wild, immediately take the blue leaf token (-3 victory points at the end of the game).

boardgame.name: Modern Royalty
boardgame.description:
Modern Royalty is a trick-taking game for exactly six players using a standard 52-card deck plus two jokers.

In each hand the deck is dealt out and the players then bid; bids can be 1-36 in a suit or 1-25 in "anarchy."

If the winning bid is in a suit, that suit is trump and cards are ranked normally, except that aces are special and jokers are the lowest members of the trump suit. Play is fairly standard (must follow suit, not required to trump) except that the aces in the non-trump suits are assassins which kill trump cards, and the trump ace is a guard which stops one assassin.

If the winning bid is in anarchy, there is no trump suit and cards are ranked ace high to ten low, with the face cards being equal below the ten; the jokers form their own "pariah" suit. If a pariah is led to a trick no one wins it.

Scoring depends on whether the play was in a suit or in anarchy, and if in a suit each player's score depends in part on what is taken by three of the other five players. The player who won the bid must always achieve their bid in points or be penalized; if the bid was in a suit then other players who last bid that suit must also do this.

Play is to 626 points.

There is an optional rule for an extra "knife" bid which basically means that the knifing player(s) work deliberately against the winning bidder.

boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

In the Village of Welltig, built atop the ruined Easod Keep, lives the Crow Witch in her tall Aviary swirling with crows.

boardgame.name: Accessible Gaming Quarterly (Issue 203 - Dec 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

We are gamers. We love to play games, specifically roleplaying games, board games, LARPs, escape rooms, and anything else that requires getting together with friends both old and soon-to-be to tell stories of heroic deeds, noble struggles, or intense dramas. We are also people with disabilities. We're not always considered when it comes to how games are designed, marketed, and played. But we will not be left behind.

Accessible Gaming Quarterly is a quarterly zine focused entirely on issues facing gamers with disabilities.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: How I Decided to Write my Senior Thesis on Dungeons and Dragons
Overcharge - A Look At Imposter Syndrome
Questions and Answers with Accessible Games

boardgame.name: Solitaire 34
boardgame.description:
Solitaire 34 is played with a standard 52-card deck. It assigns court cards a value of 10 points and all other cards their face values. This gives the deck a total of 340 points; the goal of the game is to divide the deck into 10 stacks of 34 points each.

At the start of the game the player deals a row of three cards and a row of four cards. They then find any subset of those seven cards that total exactly 34, set them aside, and deal cards to fill the empty slots.

If there is no way to make 34, the player chooses one of the two rows of cards to set aside and deals a new row. They can bring the set-aside row back in later by completely emptying the row of matching size. Several rows can be set aside at any given time.

boardgame.name: Eagles
boardgame.description:
Eagles is a Diplomacy variant which is set in an alternate history Roman Empire; the game starts in Spring 118 CE shortly after the assassination of Hadrian. The game can accommodate 2-12 players but is recommended for 4-6.

Each player starts in one of a group of given supply centers and has two more from a different group as allies; which ones each player gets is determined randomly.

The basic rules are modified in three ways:


Reinforcements are handled differently.



Many spaces on the board are held by barbarians. A force entering one of these must roll a die and may be destroyed or repelled.



Naval movement and combat is very different, with multiple fleets being able to coexist in the same space, die-rolling, etc.

boardgame.name: Home Run Derby
boardgame.description:
Home Run Derby is a simple baseball game. Each player creates a nine-member team either by rolling on a table or by choosing a real team's current starting lineup; in each case only the batting averages matter.

When a baseball player comes up to bat two dice are rolled to determine if they get a hit, sacrifice, walk, or are out. If they get a hit a roll is made on a second table to determine the outcome. Bases can be stolen, which is also resolved via dice roll.

The defending player's only decision is whether to issue an intentional walk.

boardgame.name: Five Women's Lives
boardgame.description:
This is a one-session GM-less roleplaying game for two to five players. Everyone plays a poor Victorian woman living and working in Whitechapel in 1888 - people with hopes and ideals and dreams that perhaps you will help them achieve. It is a game of struggle, sadness, hope, and endings.

All funds raised by this game go directly to the East End Women's Museum (We take nothing off whatever you choose to pay).

boardgame.name: Orc Raid
boardgame.description:
Source: [centurionsreview.itch.io The Publisher Website].
Orc Raid is a video game that plays like a hex and chit wargame. It's created in the spirit of the old microgames from the 1980's. The Orcs and Trolls must leave their caves and attack the human settlements in order to steal gold. They get points for every human they kill and points for the amount of gold they return to the caves. The Orcs have to be careful though, because they lose 5 points for every orc or troll that is killed. The setup is different each game to give the game more replayability.

boardgame.name: Tortuga 2199: Playmat
boardgame.description: Tortuga 2199 large neoprene mat from the kickstarter campaign

boardgame.name: Pax Luporum: Werewolves of the Republic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

PAX LUPORUM (the Peace of Wolves) is a complete Roleplaying Game set during the mid 3rd Century BC, during the reign of the Roman Republic shortly before the Punic Wars. A Roman Republic ruled by a race of Werewolves, who vie for control of human civilization with other humanlike monsters, hiding among us.

Contained within are complete, easy to use game rules and character creation guidelines for playing Humans, Werewolves, Merfolk, and Olympian Godlings. Details on the world of 250 BCE and its spirit-world shadow are also provided, allowing for optional Ghost Characters, as well as creature stats for some the last remaining monsters of the classic age.

Whether you want campaigns of political intrigue or high adventure, of seaborne exploration and conquest, or the inevitable clash of civilizations, PAX LUPORUM: Werewolves of the Republic provides you with the tools you need for endless adventure!
boardgame.rpg: Pax Luporum: Werewolves of the Republic

boardgame.name: Ghosts of the Shadow Zone!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ghosts of the Shadow Zone! is not only one, but TWO whole tabletop roleplaying games rolled into one!

Enter the SHADOW ZONE as a newly deceased Ghost, and play in a surreal horror-survival campaign with your fellow Characters, as you learn to navigate the afterlife, and discover its strange, terrible secrets!

Or do battle with shadowy forces as a member of one of three detailed international occult conspiracies!

The GLOBAL VOODOO SYNDICATE: A Black-Power inspired organization of werewolf and vampire hunters who trace their origins back to Ancient Africa, and are locked in an ancient vendetta with the followers of Anubis!

The LESBIAN ILLUMINATI: A Global Coven of Feminist and LGBT Witches, who protect the institutions of learning they have infiltrated from Ghosts, Demons, and other threats from the Shadow Zone!

The HEAD OF THE JACKAL: A Satanic Cabal of business moguls who use their occult skills to gather fabulous wealth and power, both in the worlds of the Living, and the Dead!

PLUS: Tons of setting information and ideas for Game Masters to run a Sandbox Style tabletop roleplaying game, complete with rules, two separate Character Creation sections for both Ghosts and Mortals, and NPC information for a wide array of antagonistic Ghosts, Cultists, and all manner of supernatural beings.

GHOSTS of the SHADOW ZONE is set during the early 1970's to help you capture the feel of classic occult horror films such as the Exorcist, Rosemary's Baby, and numerous Hammer Films and Italian movies of the era. It is also set in the same universe as EXPEDITION to ANCIENT AEGYPT, and can make a remarkable sourcebook to flesh out the magic and afterlife of the Bronze Age!

boardgame.name: Expedition to Ancient Aegypt!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

EXPEDITION to ANCIENT AEGYPT! is a complete Tabletop Roleplaying Game with rules for Character Creation, adventuring, and numerous NPCs and Monsters for your players to face. Easy to play Old School Design Philosophy made with the 90's gamer in mind. If you are a fan of pulp fantasy, ancient aliens, and classic adventuring, then Expedition to Ancient Aegypt is the Game for You!

IN the year 1911, International Geographer Quarterly sponsored an expedition to explore the ruins of southern Egypt in search of the lost tomb of Nesbanebdjed the 1st. The expedition was large and well-funded, with members from around the globe, representing 6 different great Nations. Under the leadership of Lord Bartholemew Mahoney, the venture was seemingly charmed from the start. The expedition members all met in Cairo in a timely manner, and made their way up the Nile river via steamboat without incident, to reach the ancient city of Thebes. Once they had disembarked and traded travel by boat for travel by camel, they followed the ancient map that Lord Mahoney had pieced together, and found the buried tomb for which they had sought in record time. The sent a telegram back to IGQ headquarters on July 11th 1911.

IT was the first and last communication International Geographer Quarterly would receive from them once they reached the site of Nesbanebdjed’s royal grave.

THE Expedition spent two weeks uncovering the entrance to the buried structure, and another week struggling to get the massive stone doors to open. Once inside, however, their persistence would seemingly pay off, for they discovered a veritable treasure trove of artifacts and art within the tomb’s chambers. While you and the others examined and documented the many relics to be found, Lord Mahoney was solely focused on finding the burial chamber of Queen Nesbanebdjed. It was a little past midnight, on their third day exploring the tomb, that Lord Mahoney found the secret door, and pushed it open.

YOU, and your fellow Players, are the members of the Expedition who just happened to be at hand when Lord Mahoney asked for assistance entering the burial chamber. The room was large with walls and ceiling covered in brightly painted hieroglyphs. The only treasure within it was a large golden sarcophagus placed in the center of the chamber. The lid was decorated in precious gems, and sculpted as a deathmask of Queen Nesbanebdjed’s noble features. With the help of some crowbars, you were able to help Lord Mahoney remove the lid.

INSIDE lay a woman wrapped in ancient linen, holding a large gemstone that glowed with an amber hue. Lord Mahoney picked up the crystal and held it aloft. To the horror of all who witnessed it, the mummified woman in the sarcophagus reached up to grab Mahoney’s arm.

THE crystal fell from Lord Mahoney’s hand, and broke apart on the edge of the sarcophagus with a brilliant flash of yellow. The room shook violently, and all the lamps and torches went out as the ceiling started to collapse. You felt yourself falling into darkness.

Falling...

boardgame.name: Escape from Planet Matriarchy!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Wonderful... a STUNNINGLY conceived feminist critique of classic post-atomic science fiction, allowing players to explore many of the lingering tropes of the Roleplaying Game genre through a critical lense!" - Women's Journal of Review Studies

In the year 1975, NASA scientists launched an experimental rocket to test Dr. Braun Von Schnitzelbraum’s controversial Lightspeed Overthruster. The initial phase of the mission went according to plan, but when the crew reached lunar orbit and activated the Overthruster, communications with the rocket ceased with a burst of static, and NASA’s radar tracking lost sight of the craft as it accelerated beyond the orbit of Saturn. Weeks passed with no renewed contact with the craft, and all crew, including Von Schnitzelbraum himself, were declared dead. All evidence and details of this experimental mission were classified and the files conveniently lost several years later when a small fire mysteriously broke out in NASA’s records room, ensuring that Dr. Von Schnitzelbraum’s work never found its way into Communist hands.

The mission, however, was not a failure. It was, in fact, extremely successful. At 10:15 AM on the 14th of May 1975 Dr. Von Schnitzelbraum activated the Lightspeed Overthruster and the experimental rocket, the Athena-3, smoothly accelerated to its maximum projected flight speed. The Athena-3 maintained its speed and heading for 1 hour, and came to a stop far beyond the outermost reaches of the Oort Cloud. The crew performed a flight systems check, Dr. Von Schnitzelbraum looked over the data collected from the engine test, and the rocket was turned around for the return voyage. 20 minutes into that flight, the Lightspeed Overthruster imploded, and the Athena-3 was subjected to sudden deceleration.

Saturn and its moons loomed menacingly ahead as the rocket regained control. Captain Bill “Brick” Stone, commander of the mission, ordered his co-pilot to take Von Schnitzelbraum into the escape pod while he tried to save the rest of the crew by executing an emergency crash landing on the moon of Titan. Captain Stone sent one last message back to Earth over the radio before the crash, telling his wife that he loved her. The Athena-3 then fell through Titan’s atmosphere like a falling star, and broke apart as it crashed into the moon’s surface. Captain Stone was killed by the impact, and you are among the few who survived...

boardgame.name: Dracula's Carpathian Christmas!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Christmas Comes to Victorian Era Transylvania in this game of Gothic Holiday Horror, written as a prequel of sorts to the classic novel, "Dracula", by Bram Stoker.

For over 400 years there has been no Christmas in Transylvania, but in the year 1887 all of that is about to change, when your Players embark on a magical quest to Grant Dracula's Christmas Wish!

But first they must decide whether their Character is Naughty or Nice:

NICE BOYS get to play as Christmas Elves, dispatched by Santa himself to find out what Dracula wants for Christmas. NAUGHTY BOYS will play as Werewolves who serve the ancient Voivod, and seek to find a way to make their master happy so that he may lift their terrible Curse.

NAUGHTY GIRLS get to play as one of Dracula's Vampire Brides, who hopes that getting Dracula the perfect gift will convince him to release her from the bond of his vampiric blood. NICE GIRLS will play as the Authentic Medieval Wenches, a secret coven of witches that plot to bring the Christmas Spirit back to Transylvania, no matter the cost.

Dracula's Carpathian Christmas is a complete Role Playing Game with rules for gameplay and Character Creation, as well as side-quests and adventure ideas, NPCs and Monsters, and 8 Tiny Reindeer to give you all the tools you need to run a complete Campaign to see if your Players have what it takes to Grant Dracula's Fondest Wish, and help the good people of Transylvania to have a Carpathian Christmas!

boardgame.name: Cowgirls vs. Zombies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cowgirls vs Zombies is a complete roleplaying game for One-Shot Adventures and Short Campaigns where players take on the roles of women on the American Frontier, forced to survive in the face of a zombie outbreak in the Colorado Territories of 1866.

Rules are provided for gameplay, Character Creation, and a detailed look at Ghosts and how they go about possessing the living and the dead, as well as a variety of other supernatural menaces from the Shadow Zone!

Cowgirls vs Zombies is compatible with both Amazon Time Barbarians, and Ghosts of the Shadow Zone, to provide a glimpse into the horrors of the Old American West. Open-ended gameplay allows Game Masters and Players to either run a quick and dirty shoot-em-up as our Cowgirl heroes fight their way out of Zombie-infested Denver, or the adventure can be stretched out over multiple sessions, should the Players choose to find a way to end the Zombie plague, and save their afflicted families and friends.

boardgame.name: Amazon Time Barbarians!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

AMAZON TIME BARBARIANS is a complete Post-Apocalyptic B-Movie Inspired Tabletop Roleplaying Game, with rules and Character Creation for playing Savage and Beautiful Amazon Warrior Maidens, whisked away from certain doom during the final hours of Atlantis, and hurled thousands of years into the future, to the distant, dystopian world of 1999!

With the help of the HASHTAG RESISTANCE, COWGIRL MOUNTED CAVALRY, and the fine folks at NASA, our ferocious feminine femme fatales will battle the nefarious forces of Silicon Valley as they seek to destroy the Morale of North America's Liberated Women!

Mutant monsters, genetically altered hillbilly freaks, and much much more awaits your team of Amazon Time Barbarians. But dare they face the greatest Warlord of the wastelands in the Cage Dome 2000? Dare they face the wrath of The Rogan Joe, King of the Internet?

boardgame.name: Lady Spy Detective
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lady Spy Detective is a quick, simple and easy to use Tabletop Roleplaying Game for Game Masters looking to run a solo campaign for their spouse or partner, who will take on the role of a Lady Spy Detective in the Pulp Noir setting of the fictionalized 1950's of film and television.

Included are complete game rules, character creation, a starting setting, international espionage agencies, and guidelines for creating a variety of NPCs and Villains for your Lady Spy Detective to go up against. Solve high profile mysteries in exotic locations around the world, while trying to not blow your cover, in this pulse-pounding action/mystery adventure game.

boardgame.name: The Young and the Restless Dead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hollywood, 1972.

A war is brewing behind the scenes of Tinseltown, as several supernatural factions vie for control of the Film and Television industry. In the Young and the Restless Dead, a Sourcebook for Ghosts of the Shadow Zone, Game Masters and Players are presented with options for campaigns based around Hollywood and its shadowy masters. Featuring:

The DEAD ACTORS GUILD: Jump in front of the camera in the role of one of Hollywood's biggest stars, who has undergone a mysterious procedure to preserve their youth for centuries to come.

ZORRO and the VAMPIRES: Hide behind the camera as one of the vampire minions of the infamous Diego Vega, who has ruled over California's nightlife since the days of colonial Spain.

The WIRE FIGHTERS UNION: Newcomers to the Hollywood Scene, the Wire Fighters Union is a front for a centuries old school of Martial Arts mastery, ready to make the leap from Hong Kong to America's silver screens.

The PACIFIC VOODOO KINGS: details one of the regional cells of the Global Voodoo Syndicate, and how the Nubian Brotherhood is using them to infiltrate Hollywood to hunt down the supernatural predators that feed on Los Angeles' unsuspecting citizenry.

Plus details on an emerging plague of Hollywood Zombies, Inquisitorial Censorship Boards, NPCs like Lilith Van Havilland and Diego Vega/El Zorro, and Character creation guidelines for Mummies, Vampires, Mystic Martial Artists and Voodoo Vampire Hunters!

boardgame.name: Secrets of the Lesbian Illuminati!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Who's that girl over there?"

"Oh, her? Yeah, you're barking up the wrong tree, buddy. She's part of the Lesbian Illuminati."

"What's the Lesbian Illuminati?"

"They're the girls that run this University. Now hurry up, we got football practice in five mintes!"

SECRETS of the LESBIAN ILLUMINATI is a Sourcebook for Ghosts of the Shadow Zone, detailing the Characters, Magic, Locations, and Rivals of everyone's favorite international conspiracy of witchcraft and LGBT activism! This Sourcebook Includes:

Character Creation Guidelines for playing College Witches!

Expanded Rules for Witchcraft: Common Spells and Potion Making!

Setting details for both Chancellor University, and its Shadow Zone counterpart: Graves University!

New Spirits and Demons for Lesbian Illuminati Campaigns!

A Rival Occult Conspiracy: the Daughters of the Heavenly Lotus!

This Sourcebook is a MUST HAVE for any Ghosts of the Shadow Zone Campaign, full of resources to expand the scope of adventures for Characters both Alive and Deceased!

boardgame.name: Rocket Cadets in the 11th Dimension
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rocket Cadets in the 11th Dimension! is a complete Campaign Setting with rules for Character Creation and gameplay, compatible with other Total Party Skills games like Amazon Time Barbarians and Escape from Planet Matriarchy.

Game Masters take on the role of Cadet Instructor, and design the Rocketship used by your Players' Cadet Characters as they are sent hurtling into the 11th Dimension, to find a way to stop an interdimensional invasion of Earth by ancient alien races, and find a way home to the 25th Century!

Players can take on the roles of 25th Century NASA Cadets from one of several worlds in the Solar System, or they can even play one of several alien species that dwell in the mysterious 11th Dimension...

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Attachments I
boardgame.description:
House Stark is known for extolling integrity, justice, and loyalty. Those that flock to the Direwolf’s Banner feel that what they are fighting for is right. This feeling is instilled in the officers that are in charge of the units within the Stark army. House Stark might not have the deepest coffers, but what they lack in raw materials they make up for in determination.

The Stark Unit Attachments box set gives House Stark players in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game 11 new Unit Attachments that they can use to customize their forces. They can enhance their troops with the likes of Sworn Sword Captain, Umber Champion, Crannogman Warden, and more. Each one will allow Stark players to build an army that fits exactly the type of battle they want to fight.

Contents:
11 Miniatures
‣ 2 Sworn Sword Captains
‣ 2 Umber Champions
‣ 2 Crannogman Wardens
‣ 2 Mormont Veterans
‣ 2 Crannogman Survivalists
‣ 1 Winterfell Guardian
11 Attachment Cards
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
CLS Games - Atlanta's Board Game Warehouse - is the largest retailer of board games in metro Atlanta! All games are new & still in factory shrink-wrap.
SONG OF ICE AND FIRE STARK ATTACHMENTS: 24.99 Cool Mini [CMN SIF116]
SHIPPING Continental U.S. - 12.95 International (Including AK & HI) - TBD

boardgame.name: We Want Soviet Men
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You and your Glorious Republics of Comrade Players will be having the State Mandated Fun and Action Excitement of Space Travel!

As New Comrade Master you find tools for Glorious Soviet Space Campaign with Sourcebook for Resource Materials within!

Creating the Comrade Cosmonaut will be easy for the Character Player Comrades!

New Regulations to be playing as Glorious Soviet Starship Comrade for Player Comrades!

boardgame.name: Beyond Cage Dome 2000
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you demand Justice for the wastelands of 1999 North America?

Do you demand CAGE DOME 2000?

If the answer is yes, you won't need another hero after getting your hands on Beyond CAGE DOME 2000!

Battle for the freedom of North America's Liberated Women against the Tyranny of The Rogan Joe in BEYOND CAGE DOME 2000! An Amazon Time Barbarians TRIPLE FEATURE! Three mini-sourcebooks in one convenient package, giving you the tools you need to flesh out several seasons of adventures as your Amazon Time Barbarians quest to seize the means of production from the Warlords of Silicon Valley:

SYNDROME of the STOCKHOLM SISTERHOOD: a complete Introductory Aventure that sets your team of Amazon Time Barbarians on a path to liberate the Captive Women of Coloradonia, with scenarios and NPCs to introduce new players to the rules and factions of the distant future of 1999...

AMAZON PRISON GIRLS: a new Faction of Ferocious Female Freedom Fighters to add to your campaign as either NPC allies, or as new Characters, as the Amazon Time Barbarians cross the deserts of Silicon Valley in search of The Rogan Joe's lair...

AMAZON TIME BARBARIANS in the HOLO-EARTH: What terrible secrets await your team of Amazon Time Barbarians once they reach the CAGE DOME 2000? Will they find the Center of the Holo-Earth, and its enigmatic master? Are the Amazon Time Barbarians truly destined to defeat The Rogan Joe?

boardgame.name: Ancient Aegypt Conquers Mars!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

ANCIENT AEGYPT CONQUERS MARS is a Campaign Expansion for Mid-Level Characters, for use with the Expedition to Ancient Aegypt rulebook.

Send your Players on a Bronze Age Space Adventure to the mythical Red Planet, where an Undead Necromancer from Ancient Aegypt seeks to dethrone the Olympians of Thaumasia, and declare himself a god!

Includes Rules for Monstrous Player Characters that can be used both for the primary Aegpyt setting, or with the Martian Setting presented herein. CENTAURS, LIZARDMEN, MINOTAURS and SIRENS!

Rules are also included to design unique Bronze Age Starships, as well as information on a number of new NPCs and creatures to add to any Ancient Aegypt Campaign!

Whether you use it as a resource for Characters, Starships, or to play through the Adventure Script with a group of Mid-Level Characters, ANCIENT AEGYPT CONQUERS MARS is the Sourcebook you need to really put the "Alien" back in Ancient Aegypt!

boardgame.name: The Curse of Lord Mahoney's Fedora!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The CURSE of LORD MAHONEY'S FEDORA! is a complete Introductory Adventure for use with EXPEDITION to ANCIENT AEGYPT!

The Adventure begins the moment the Characters arrive in 1054 BC, and will take them on a tense journey of supernatual mystery and discovery!

See the great city of THEBES!

Meet with the High Priests of Amun at KARNAK!

Travel across desert, or sail down the iconic Nile River, to reach the forbidden city of ABYDOS!

Characters will come face to face with their nightmares in the secret temple beneath the MOUNTAIN of ANUBIS!

PLUS: Vampire Maidens, a Crocodile Village, and Special Rewards!

boardgame.name: 20 Scenes to Save Me (or not) Core Rules
boardgame.description: 20 Scenes to Save Me is an rpg system designed to experience a storyline set in a medical drama. Players take on the role of doctors trying to uncover patients’ illnesses before it is too late. Its design lends itself to solo play by writing out scenes as they occur, while a multiplayer mode would involve all players being Teammates from the same medical team and the GM controlling insights gained from research, NPCs, and the general happenings in the setting. To play this game you will need a full dice set (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20), though a percentile die is not strictly necessary. Possible inspirational material for game narratives might include House, ER, Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman, General Hospital, and Diagnosis Murder.

boardgame.name: Orc+Bone
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

ORC+BONE is set at the end of fantasy history, in a world where the Elves, Dwarves, and now Humanity itself have disappeared, and Orcs have found themselves in the unlikely position of having to defend what remains of civilization, rebuilding it in their image in the process. They will face a host of villains: Vampires, Mutants, Sidhe, Werewargs and Dragons among them. As well as rival factions of the Orcish Crusades, and the Goblin Federacy!

ORC+BONE also features quick-play miniatures rules, allowing you and your players to recreate large scale battles with a relative handful of standard sized minis! Control entire legions of Orcish Crusaders and Vampire Minions in a straight-forward tactical wargame!

boardgame.name: Total Party Skills Character Records
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Universal and Printable Character Record Sheet created by DM Curt for use with all Total Party Skills game titles.
boardgame.rpg: Pax Luporum: Werewolves of the Republic

boardgame.name: Beast in Show
boardgame.description:
Fantasy monster pet deck builder. Create the ultimate team of monsters, beasts, and cryptic to compete in pet competitions. Collect pets, companions, and abilities of different elements and combine their powers to win the most trophies.

Each player starts with a deck of ten starter cards, and a starting pet. Your pet stays out on your player mat, ready to compete using its Beauty, Brains, and Brawn stats! Each turn, draw 5 cards from your deck. Some cards will add points to your pets' Beauty, Brains, or Brawn statistics. Others have money that let you buy more powerful cards or pets from the marketplace. Cards can also contain abilities that let you improve your hand, improve your pets, or sabotage your competitors! All cards also align to one of four elements. By pairing cards of the same element, you can activate even better abilities and add extra pets to your game board to help win competitions. After buying cards, placing pets on your mat, activating abilities, or any combination of those things, place your hand in the discard pile, and draw a new hand. As the game progresses, your deck will grow more and more powerful!

Once the pets on your player mat, with the assistance of any cards in your hand that turn, have enough Beauty, Brains, and Brawn, go claim your prize! Each trophy has a unique combination of statistics required to claim, and once you've claimed a prize no one else can claim the same one. Trophies also give you victory points to win the game. But be careful. Once your pets win a trophy, they retire and you will need to purchase new ones for the next competition.

Play until all the competitions are claimed, then add up victory points from your trophies. Be strategic: some cards, including pets, also contain victory points that count towards victory. So don't assume the person with the most trophies is always the winner!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Creature Spirits Pack 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version

(for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

We do one of these every couple of months to catch-up a little bit before the tokens pile up even more ^^

This pack contains all tokens from “Creature Tokens Pack 10, Pack 11, Pack 12, Pack 13 in Spirit Forms.
All in 4 Color Variants as usual (Blue, Green, Purple, White).

Total # of tokens in this pack: 236!

boardgame.description:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version
(for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

We do one of these every couple of months to catch-up a little bit before the tokens pile up even more ^^

This pack contains all tokens from Creature Tokens – Pack 14, Pack 15, Pack 16, Pack 17, Pack 18 in Spirit Forms.
All in 4 Color Variants as usual (Blue, Green, Purple, White).

boardgame.name: Table Clutter Pack 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New Table Clutter is here!

This one has a healthy mix of Treasures!

Hope you guys like them!

Total # of Assets in this pack: 1361!

More individual pieces coming soon.

Some destroyed furniture and some such after that!

More individual pieces coming soon.

Some destroyed furniture and some such after that!

Total # of Assets in this pack: 1094!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 13
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gotta fill those lairs of the baddies with something!
Sooooo much treasure you can swim in it! Until the dragon comes back…
All these piles work standalone but you can also combine them!

They come in Gold, Silver, Copper & Mixed variants

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The destruction continues!

Broken / Damaged / Fallen chairs, stools and tables! As well as Fallen Doors

Total # of Assets in this pack: 354!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 15
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Going on an adventure?

It's dangerous to go alone... Take one of these!

Some nice and shiny fancy/magical weapons for all your adventuring needs

Total # of Assets in this pack: 391!

Moar Dungeon Decor and a bit of destruction

You can find Broken glass shards and piles, as well as broken wall endings and Display Cases!

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version

Additional batch of SRD Creatures

boardgame.name: Hero Tokens Pack 6
boardgame.description:
