This pack consists of 12 new Heroes (or Villains)!

Every token is available in Multiple color variants!

Total # of Tokens in this pack: 152!

boardgame.name: Textures 07
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New, more detailed and improved options for gravel/stone/dirt and grass!

There will be more textures coming out soon as well, most notably desert ones… finally.

boardgame.name: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland Core Rulez Quick Start Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Quick Start Edition!

Jump right into the best RPG in the Neon Wastelands! Includes the adventure "Last Outpost on the Left".

The Quick Start has all the rules and info needed for 3 classes (Brutacorm, Cosmic Barbarian, and War Wizard) to run through some Neon Lords goodness!

This is what you will find in the Main Core Rulez!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Turquoise Valley
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Turquoise Valley is a fictional frontier town that is usable for a variety of old west territories. Focus should be on a prairie location with surrounding copper and turquoise mining interests. This is a town that is not yet connected to the railroad but close enough to rail expansion to make the concept of a potential station feasible. This community has its share of conflicts and potential for violence and corruption, just like the real world settlements in the old west.

This product is designed in a manner to be compatible with most old west tabletop role playing games. Game specific rules are left out as well as specific prices on things. There are references to real world localities, which the GM is free to change or remove as needed. Though intended for realistic western settings this location could also be used for weird west, fantasy fusion, western horror, and other larger than life setting variants. The product consists of a brief background, two maps (one numbered and one note), and descriptions of each numbered map entry. Sprinkled throughout the entries are various notes that provide the GM potential for conflict, adventure hooks, and/or interesting encounters.

Background
Built just outside of copper mining territory, Turquoise Valley enjoyed enough early success to allow the community to grow into a thriving little prairie town. Though still prosperous, there are signs that the economy is starting to slow down. Mayor McCarty has dreams of using his connection to the railroad company to establish a new train station in town. Being linked up to western railroad expansion is what the mayor believes will allow the community to survive and grow into a small city.

Not everyone shares the mayor’s vision. Business entrepreneur Jacob Hound seeks to gain majority control over Turquoise Valley’s economic interests and these plans would further limit his influence. Mr. Hound’s business investments are doing just fine without such growth and the entrepreneur would love run Mr. McCarty out of town and assume the role of mayor. Unfortunately for Mayor McCarty his rival Mr. Hound has a few supporters in Turquoise Valley who are not afraid to dish out a few dirty deeds…

boardgame.name: Parikrama
boardgame.description:
Parikrama is a relaxing, yet witty travel card game. In this game, you are a solo traveler wandering through a myriad of landscapes in the pursuit of discovery, adventure and enlightenment - traversing across forests, rivers, deserts and valleys that come along your path... occasionally discovering monuments along your way to rejuvenate and pray.

There are a lot of choices to be made - taking a shorter journey can help you move faster in the game, but a longer journey can be more rewarding, additionally landing you a chance to hitch-hike on your next journey via a bullock carriage, a riverboat ferry.. or even jump on the truck to travel even faster!

Completing a journey awards you with not just points but experience as well, which will help you travel more efficiently as the game progresses. Every journey also gifts you with an inscribed tile, a lost clay tablet with mysterious symbols and patterns that unveil fantastic Parikrama routes of the ancient times! When connected carefully, these tiles yield powerful results - and the player who first joins a pattern of 9 tiles, has completed their Parikrama map and triggers the end game!

The player with the best balance of a vivid journal, the right collection of symbols and Parikrama routes gathers the most points and wins the game!

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Dothraki Screamers
boardgame.description:
The warrior ways of the Dothraki might make them appear as simple barbarian savages, screaming into the sky as they charge into battle. And many commanders have underestimated them because of those stereotypes. A Dothraki will spend more time on their horse than they will off of it, and with that experience comes skill that regular training will never achieve. Despite being unarmored, it is still difficult for a trained swordsman to land a significant hit on a mounted Dothraki.

The Dothraki Screamers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Targaryen commanders a solid cavalry unit for their forces. These fearsome fighters can charge quickly into battle, dealing out deadly blows. Skilled commanders will use them as a lightning-fast strike force, avoiding getting them into protracted combats, lest their fewer numbers start to catch up with them.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

boardgame.name: The Complete NPC
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Generate unplanned NPCs quickly! Players are continually encountering NPCs you never planned for, but now you can combine almost anything quickly to create the NPC you need!

For each NPC you painstakingly create and detail, you will need at least ten more, for which you never planned. If your players have one superpower, it is to go completely off-script and end up in some corner of your world you never designed, fighting things for which you never made statistics.

But with these guidelines, you can quickly combine any race with any existing NPC.

boardgame.name: El Cubil de Panthracus
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Aventura pensada para un grupo de jugadores novatos.

Panthracus es un paladin ca¢tico que sirve al dios de la muerte , en este caso Bhaal. Tiene un plan para arrasar las aldeas circundantes. Para ello se ha instalado en unas ruinas, ha montado un peque¤o culto a Bhaal y ha atra¡do a todos los ricos hacendados de los alrededores como seguidores y, de paso, como mecenas. Con parte del tesoro conseguido ha podido traer a un lejano y poderoso mago - Fhormalon - y comprarle uno de sus objetos m gicos, Bakara, una esfera de color rojo rub¡ que tiene la cualidad de poseer las mentes convirtiendo al sujeto en esclavo del poseedor y volviendo sus ojos del mismo color que Bakara. con ella, est  reclutando al ej‚rcito que llevar acabo sus planes de conquista.

boardgame.name: El Legado de Lord Arrakis
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hemos de aclarar que este módulo no es de creación propia, sino que es importado de la red. De todos modos nos gustó tanto que decidimos ponerlo en la página del club para que más gente tenga oportunidad de verlo y jugarlo. Nuestra única aportación al módulo ha sido el mapa de la iglesia.

Esta aventura puede ser utilizada en cualquier juego AD&D aunque puede ser fácilmente adaptada a cualquier otro juego. Esta aventura es para unos 5 jugadores de nivel 1-2.

boardgame.name: El Sifón Subterráneo
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

En una ciudad de 7500 habitantes donde los únicos autorizados para portar armas es la guardia del principado (guerreros nivel 3) los compañeros se internan en Altic donde son sorprendidos infringiendo una ley local. La multa es 1 pieza de oro, decomiso de las armas hasta que se marchen de la ciudad y presentación semanal ante el visitador Raúl para verificar el comportamiento adecuado de los visitantes y se les asigna un tutor. El tutor es un panadero de la plaza llamado Bread, gentilhombre.

boardgame.name: El Rapto de Fenolah
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Era un pueblo tranquilo. Tranquilo como cualquier pueblo agricultor y comerciante de los alrededores, hasta que llegó la mala época.

Nadie entendía bien por qué, o si había una causa, pero de un mes para el otro, todo empezó a ir mal. Las cosechas se perdían. El comercio disminuía. La gente estaba deprimida. Los niños no nacían. La gente se enfermaba.

Era como si la muerte en persona hubiera llegado al tranquilo pueblito.

boardgame.name: El Tomo XXIII
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Después de varios días vagando por el bosque, durante uno de los cuales un PJ al azar caerá enfermo, aparecerá delante de los PJ un monasterio construido en la cima de una gran colina. El monasterio, construido completamente en piedra, es tan sumamente majestuoso que si hay algún enano o elfo en el grupo deseara quedarse durante 1D6 horas sentado contemplando el monasterio además hay algún mago permanecerá 2D6 horas sin poder hablar por el asombro producido al percibir el aura de poder del monasterio. El monasterio pertenece dios de la neutralidad por lo que no producirá cambio alguno en la alineación de los personajes el permanecer allí.

boardgame.name: El Último Sueño
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Despues de un largo día agotador su cuerpo les duele como pocas veces , se dirigen cansados pero satisfechos por su labor hacia la posada que promete darles descanso y comodidad.

User summary:

The scenario is published as four DOC files:

Introducción (5 pp. US Letter)
El Último Sueño (52. pp. A4)
Apéndice (5 pp. US Letter)
Monstruos (2 pp. US Letter)

boardgame.name: Hielo y Sangre
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Los jugadores se encuentran extenuados a causa del esfuerzo que supone avanzar a través de la fría y helada estepa con una fuerte ventisca de nieve encima.

Una tirada de Inteligencia con éxito, revelará a los Pj’s unos distantes aullidos de lobos. A medida que los jugadores sigan avanzando, deberán pasar una tirada de Constitución cada uno. En caso de no pasarla, los jugadores caerán de sus caballos (1d menos en todas sus tiradas) quedando inconscientes hasta que puedan descansar. Si alguno de los jugadores pasa una tirada de Inteligencia se dará cuenta de que los aullidos se oyen cada vez más cerca.

boardgame.name: Historias de Otro Plano
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Esta historia es para unos 5 jugadores de nivel 3. Es necesario que alguien del grupo hable en elfo, y sería recomendable que no fuera uno solo.

Estando en la posada oyen llegar a un carruaje. Al poco tiempo 4 hombres con armadura y armados con espadas entra en la posada. Tras ellos un tipo con traje lujoso (Mir'hir). Mir'hir se acerca al posadero y habla con el, pero no saben de que, por que estan muy lejos. De repente ven como el posadero les apunta con el dedo. Mir'hir se les acerca y se presenta con buenos modales. Es Mir'hir hijo de Athdrer, conde de Haroldor. (25 % cada uno de saber donde esta). Haroldor es una tierra lejana, muy prospera, pero todavía no del todo explorada. Les dice que el posadero le ha dicho acaban de volver de una aventura. Les dirá que tiene una misión que encomendarles. Les dice que él y su padre se deberían haber encontrado un día antes aquí, en Adrior (o donde estén), pero que su padre no había llegado y que le preocupaba. Dice que le parece muy raro, y que le gustaría que alguien explorara el camino hacia el Norte. Si leencuentran deben escoltarle hasta Adrior, y que si creen que le ha pasado algo, que vuelvan y lo digan. Les dice que no es demasiado peligroso, pero que si aceptan les pagar 200 mo a cada uno en ese momento y otras 200 mo si le traen a Adrior, o si descubren lo que le ha pasado. Si aceptan les pedirá que partan en ese momento. Son casi las 11 de la mañana.

boardgame.name: Los Reinos de Kronos
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Los reinos de Kronos en una aventura del juego AD&Dtm para 4 a 8 PJs de niveles 6 al 9 (unos 45 niveles en total).
...
La mañana aún no ha despuntado en vuestro campamento pero vosotros habéis comenzado ya ha recoger, atrás quedan las secuelas de la última gran aventura y en vuestra mente imagináis los peligros y tesoros de la siguiente.

boardgame.name: La Ciudad Perdida
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hace cientos de años existió una comarca llamada Brownstone, que albergaba en su interior una de las ciudades comerciales más importantes de todo el mundo: Lentaria. Era tal su riqueza que incluso los esclavos estaban adornados con piedras preciosas. Su poder y orgullo eran debidos a las Minas Profundas, que albergaban en su interior un cúmulo de materiales de las mas diversas formas: hierro, plata, oro, diamantes e incluso el material más preciado: el acero. Esto provocó la llegada de todo tipo de personas, desde hombres a hanflings, pasando por Enanos (que se encargaban de excavar las cuevas), Elfos (que se dedicaban al comercio) y personajes de demás ralea. Los comerciantes llegaban a raudales, por lo que se formaron varias escuelas (de magia, de combate) y un sinfín de tiendas con artículos preciosos (desde joyas a armas, pasando por toda una serie de artefactos mágicos). También llegaron a Lentaria toda una serie de ladrones, estafadores y asesinos, que se reunían en lugares secretos que cambiaban a medida que los guardias descubrían los antigüos.

boardgame.name: La Maldición de Khor Shabin
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Khor Shabin es el nombre de una fortaleza situada en las faldas de los montes de la verdad, todo el pueblo mejor dicho toda la aldea, se sitúa alrededor de este núcleo. Su economía se basa fundamentalmente en la explotación agrícola y ganadera. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una zona tranquila, bueno casi siempre.

boardgame.name: La Mina Maldita
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Esta aventura esta dise¤ada para que la jueguen 3 ¢ 4 personajes con niveles comprendidos entre 1 y 5.
...
Un dia hace tres meses llegaron dos extranjeros malheridos a Findal, pueblo situado cerca de la union del Entwash con el Anduin, en la parte sur de MONTA¥ITAS. Sus habitantes les alimentaron y curaron sus heridas. Dijeron que hab¡an sido desvalijados por una banda de ladrones y que hab¡an sido hechos prisioneros para ser vendidos como esclavos, pero consiguieron escapar y han vagabundeado hasta encontrar este pueblo.

boardgame.name: La Torre de Trademark
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Módulo para AD&D orientado a un grupo de unos cinco aventureros de niveles 3-5. A cargo de ICMA.

Estáis de camino a una pequeña aldea llamada Trademark, en el salvaje norte. Según tenéis entendido es una población de pescadores y talladores de madera de ule (árbol de madera azulada que sólo crece en esta parte del mundo conocido). Trademark se ha hecho famosa en los pueblos vecinos en los últimos días. Según los rumores el pueblo está asustado por la misteriosa aparición de una torre negra. La torre parece desvanecerse de día sin dejar rastro para volver a aparecer de noche. Vuestro espíritu aventurero os ha impulsado a dirigiros allí para husmear un poco.

boardgame.name: Las Arenas del Destino
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“Las Arenas del Destino” es una aventura preparada para un grupo de 4-8 personajes jugadores de niveles bajos, de 1 a 3 está bien.Se recomienda que los jugadores no usen Pjs que utilicen habitualmente, porque hay un 99% de posibilidades de que mueran en el transcurso de la aventura.Por lo tanto es recomendable que se usen Pjs recién creados.Los Pj no deberán conocerse, por lo que también será preciso hacer el proceso de conocerse.Es un trabajo arduo el crear personajes que van a morir seguramente, pero la idiosincrasia de la aventura merece la pena hacer este trabajo.Esta aventura fue pensada y escrita por mí, y os aseguro que mis jugadores no la han olvidado, y ya hace dos años que la jugamos.

boardgame.name: El Deseo de Lurana
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Esta es una aventura pensada para un grupo de 5-6 Pjs de Nivel 5 o 6 pero puede ser facilmente adaptada para cualquier nivel cambiando el nivel de los enemigos (Los Valeren) a uno apropiado.

Los Pjs pueden ser de cualquier clase y alineamiento pero sería mejor que fueran buenos.

Las descripciones de los Pnjs están al final del documento.

boardgame.name: Covert Cues: The Deduction Game
boardgame.description:
Covert Cues is an ingenious social deduction game for 3-12 players about slick double meanings and spy talk, revolving around the premise of 2 hidden individuals attempting to discover who each other are by referencing their secret code word without being caught by the public.

"The Hacker and the insider Admin have planned to finally meet face to face at the monthly office meeting, in order to finalise their plans to blackmail the company.

Amongst a group of regular users, the Hacker and the Admin will attempt to identify each other by using their hidden code word.

However, the company has been made aware of the potential of an inside job and users will be alert and observant for any suspicious behaviour. If their plans are exposed, there will be drastic consequences."

boardgame.name: Lusac
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Todos conocen a Lusac, ese gordo (por algo le llaman el Gordo Lusac) que se apropio de las espadas de los Drow y toreo a los Pj que intentaban chulearle. Los pj rabiosos han intentado hundir al gordo mediante falacias y maniobras politicas. Pero Lusac siempre ha sido mas listo (o mas rico). Ahora tienen la oportunidad de redimir su estupidez.

boardgame.name: Njarda 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Situación política de la ciudad: hace un mes o mes i medio hubieron eleciones y las gano un noble llamado Amadjen. Este noble hace una politica muy liberal y pretende ampliar las rutas comerciales de la ciudad, que han mermado un poco desde hace unos años a causa que el mercado de esta ciudad era poco rentable y los comerciantes prefieren ir a Gmel, la ciudad vecina a vender sus mercancias.

boardgame.name: Njarda 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduccion: despues de la primera parte, dejamos a nuestros intrepidos PJ en una situacion un poco delicada: los habian acusado de asesinar al governador de la isla de Dergos. las pruebas eran: una daga perteneciente a uno del grupo ( el muy idiota habia escrito su nombre en la empuñadura ), que eran los unicos extrangeros en la ciudad lo suficientemente preparados para llevar a cabo el asesinato y que tenien a un mago con ellos y el sujeto habia muerto petrificado.

El governador de Njarda, el señor Amadjen, les dio dos dias para demostrar su inocencia.

boardgame.name: Njarda 3
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduccion: despues de descubrir al asesino del governador de Dergos, Amadjen les ha encargado encontrar un documento que estaba en posesion del pirata. Sus soldados ya han registrado de arriba abajo el barco y no han encontrado nada (pero no consiguieron abrir la puerta de la habitacion del capitan a no ser que los PJ hiciesen algo que les permita entrar, aun asi no encontraron el lugar secreto donde estaba el documento).

boardgame.name: Njarda 4
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Introduccion: a los pobres PJ les a tocado el gordo: despues de descubrir un asesinato, capturar al pirata mas buscado de los alrededores, encontrar ( o no ) un importante documento para el governador Amadjen, ahora este les a pedido que vayan hasta la ciudad de Gmel para eliminar la raiz del problema: el governador de Gmel. A cambio se les ofrece una gran suma de dinero ( la que creas apropiada ) y todos los honores que se les pueden dar a unos heroes desconocidos. Si hace falta sobornalos diciendo que si no lo hacen les acusaran de traidores o alguna cosa similar, no hay problema.

boardgame.name: Тактическое Лото (Tactical Lotto)
boardgame.description:
Тактическое Лото ("Tactical Lotto"), published in Moscow (Soviet Union) 1929.

Though the game is titled as Lotto game, it is typical roll and move game about war and military tactics with separate game board with 96 stops (16 cards of 6 stops each) and additional cards with questions about each stop. The first player, who cross whole route first, wins a game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Todos los Enanos Esconden una Pepita de Oro debajo de su Almohada
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Estas lineas son en realidad una de las clásicas aventurillas de dungeon que tanto me gustan así que no espereis grandes maravillas, aunque sí alguna sorpresa. Ha sido ideada para un nutrido grupo de 5-6 jugadores de nivel 3-5 que estén dispuestos a jugarse el pescuezo por el vil metal. Las profesiones son lo de menos, siempre se agradece la variedad, sin embargo un ladrón y un enano serían muy útiles. Los Reinos Olvidados son el entorno de la historia.

boardgame.name: Spectrum
boardgame.description:
Spectrum is a social deduction party card game. Win the game by best discerning where players stand within a spectrum of opinions ranging from Strongly Agree to Strongly Disagree, on topics ranging from the silly to the serious!

Each turn, a player will choose a Prompt from their hand of cards, such as "It's okay to be close to your ex," and play it alongside a Spectrum card from their hand that attempts to predict where the majority of players will stand on the issue. They will also place a token face down that reflects their own opinion.

The other players place their pawns on the Survey cards based on their personal opinions, and then the Spectrum card is revealed. If a majority of players are inside the chosen Spectrum, the prompter keeps the card for its points. Otherwise, the card is discarded.

Then, the other players discuss the hidden opinion of the prompter and together place that player's pawn on a Survey card. Each player can choose to back the group's decision and take a +1 point token, but if they choose wrong, they will have to flip it to its -1 point side!

Play continues to the left, with players taking turns as the prompter. The first player to 10 points wins!

Spectrum is an adaptation of the hit web show of the same name by Jubilee Media. After launching in 2018, Spectrum has gone on to rack up over 140 million views, and has been encouraging people from all walks of life to have deep, illuminating, challenging, and fun conversations ever since.

—description of the designer

boardgame.description:
Archi & Roleros
Ezine No. 01
Mayo 2010

boardgame.name: The Clever Knight
boardgame.description:
A strategy game for 2 players.
Try to create a sequence of 4 tiles of your color inside the inner quadrangle of the board. Tiles advance in the
familiar chess steps and may be placed on top of each other. The game has simple rules and guarantees hours of fun.
A game for developing a thinking strategy and the ability to plan moves.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: No Na Me
boardgame.description:
No Na Me is an abstract strategy game for 2 players.
Play as a ring caster, in the attempt to reach the center of the board first. On your turn choose one of four available actions:

move your player piece one space orthogonally.
take control of a minion with the top most ring on your player piece.
move a minion one space orthogonally.
pick a ring that is orthogonally adjacent to you.


Use your limited resources to manipulate the game and outwit your opponent in this slow pace ballet of deception and strategy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hungry Monkey
Голодна мавпа
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time, Hungry Monkey searched for his lost breakfast bean in the jungle. He asked the other animals for help, from Swift Sparrow to King Tiger, but they all ignored his pleas. Until Tiny Ant climbed into Tiger's ear and ordered him to help. King Tiger was scared by the voice in his ear. He commanded all animals to look for the bean, and no one dared to refuse. Eventually, Swift Sparrow found the bean, and Hungry Monkey was finally happy.

Hungry Monkey is a card game where the goal is to get rid of your hand cards and collect beans. You have animal cards both in hand and in a face-down row. You must be the first to play all your cards, first from your hand and then from your card row.

You have to play cards with the same or a higher number. You can trigger an effect with a powerful animal.

If you want to play multiple games you keep track of the scoring with Bean cards. The player with the most beans at the end of the last game wins.

—description from the publisher

Shipping to EU would be 10 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: 18Cuba
boardgame.description:
18Cuba tells a fictional story about railroading in Cuba.

The game features six large companies as well as a state company, which operates with discarded trains and fixed stations on the map. Sugar plantations are represented by small companies and special tiles that produce sugar cubes, which can be picked up by the large companies with special railroad cars and add to their income by ferrying them off at a port. Although the state railway controls most of the station tokens, you can pay it off and use them for your own company.

As usual in 18xx games, the wealthiest player at game end is the winner.

boardgame.name: Sweet & Spicy
Sweet & Spicy. Битва котиків
boardgame.description:
Once hungry Kitty craved to eat, but sadly found no yummy meat, instead just found some weird spice, scoffed it down and paid the price. From prickling hot sensation came the grand idea for this sweet game.

Sweet & Spicy is a bluffing card game for 2-6 players and the kid-friendly variant of Spicy. Instead of Wasabi you can now play with Lemon and there is a new card in the game: The SUPER-JOKER. But the game principle remains the same.

Just like in Spicy, the cards are played face down, so you can cheat when you announce your card. But it's not just about bluffing convincingly. You can almost always play a card that is at least half right if you play it skillfully from your hand. It's a matter of tactically considering which card you can get away with: Do I play a "pepper 9" better than a "chili 10" or a suit joker than a "pepper 10"? Or do I pass better, because I'm sure it will be noticeable that I've been thinking about it for so long?

In Sweet & Spicy, the super joker is added, which can be any spice and any number. It is therefore always correct and cannot be doubted.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 10 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: Tank Racer
boardgame.description:
(From the back cover of the game)

It's mad. It's fast. It's dangerous. Watch your back when you enter the world's wackiest race where blasting your opponents and bulldozing through buildings feels almost as good as winning!

- 15 turbo charged tanks to choose from, each one different from the rest
- 22 tough as nails tracks to trash, from a quiet village to a moon base
- Single race and cup modes to test every standard of driver
- 2 player split screen BATTLE and HEAD TO HEAD moded with dedicated 2 player tracks
- Tons of mega power-ups including guided missiles, land mines and even alien abduction weapon
- Masses of hidden goodies including 2 entire bonus games
- Hi-res (512 x 256) graphics

boardgame.name: Tang Hu Lu (冰糖葫芦)
boardgame.description:
Bing Tang Hu Lu is a traditional snack from China. It's a skewer of fruits (mainly little apples called Shan Zha), covered with caramelized sugar.

In the game we play the role of beloved parents who try their best to prepare this tasty and delicious snack for their children.

During each turn, players may choose to:

Buy fruit, or
Go to work


With the first action players buy fruit tokens of five different types and compose the skewers on their personal board. When a skewer is completed, they obtain rewards depending on the skewer pattern and stars (victory points) at the end of the game.

With the second action players obtain coins depending on their personal board situation.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: MiniQuest Adventures: Dice Set
boardgame.description: Additional dice set for MiniQuest Adventures. It contains two black and one white custom dice.

boardgame.name: Arco-X (No. 2 - Dic 2010/Ene 2011)
boardgame.description:
Arco-X
Ezine de la comunidad de ArchiRoleros.com
Numero 02 Diciembre-Enero

boardgame.description:
Archi & Rolero
Arco-X
Ezine
No. 3
Noviembre 2011

boardgame.name: Arco-X (No. 4 - Abr 2012)
boardgame.description:
Archi & Roleros
Arco-X 04
Abril 2012

boardgame.name: Hocus & Pocus: The Legend of Grimm's Woods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cast spells, solve puzzles, rack up sparkling stars, and train your own magical pet in this graphic novel that you can play just like a role-playing game. Enter a world inspired by favorite fairy tales, complete with gingerbread houses and a girl dressed in red. Readers can play as Hocus (a boy) or Pocus (a girl), choose a magic animal companion, and enter a colorful forest of brain-teasing riddles, magical objects, and unusual characters. Each panel has multiple paths to follow, and a handy tracking sheet helps you keep track of your victories and hard-won possessions, bringing together the classic analog adventure of a tabletop game and the fresh format of a comic book for hours of replayable fun.

HERE’S HOW TO PLAY:
• Select your character and magical pet and begin your quest.
• Numbers are hidden in every panel. Decide where you want to go next, and then flip to the panel with the matching number.
• Solve puzzles, collect supplies, and win stars in your quest for success. The more good deeds you do, the more stars you will find.
• You can play the book again and again, making different choices every time.

Remember, this is no ordinary comic book—what happens next is up to you!

boardgame.name: Arco-X (Especial Navidad - Dec 2011)
boardgame.description:
Archi & Roleros
Especial Navidad
Ezine No. 0

Issue contains mixed pages of US Letter and A4
boardgame.rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este

boardgame.name: Hocus & Pocus: The Search for the Missing Dwarves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cast spells, solve puzzles, rack up sparkling stars, and train your own magical pet in this chooseable-path comic book! In the story, Snow White is worried about her seven cousins, who work in the Heigh-Ho mine. They haven’t come home from work, and she wants you to find them. You’ll need a healthy appetite for adventure—and your magical pet—to track down the missing men and put a stop to the nefarious forces lurking in the forest. Each panel in the story offers one or more possibilities for your next move. Plus a handy Quest Tracker lets you record your victories, note your hard-won prizes, and take care of your pet, making this a book you play just like a game.

HERE’S HOW TO PLAY:
• Select your character and magical pet and begin your quest.
• Numbers are hidden in every panel. Decide where you want to go next, and then flip to the panel with the matching number.
• Solve puzzles, collect supplies, and win stars in your quest for success. The more good deeds you do, the more shining stars you will find.
• You can play the book again and again, making different choices every time.

Remember, this is no ordinary comic book—what happens next is up to you!

boardgame.name: Knights Club: The Bands of Bravery
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, adventure, and triumphant battles await you in this graphic novel that plays just like a role-playing game. Choose to play as one of three brothers eager to join the Royal Order of Knights, and keep track of your hit points, abilities, and inventory on a handy adventure tracker sheet—then set off on your quest! The road to knighthood is a long one: you will journey through snowy mountains, haunted lakes, and dark forests in search of the bracelets of bravery, facing down trolls, wizards, and fellow warriors along the way. You will solve riddles, discover hidden compartments, learn combat techniques, and gather magical objects. With the analog fun of a tabletop game and the classic elements of a fantasy video game, you'll pick your own paths and forge your own knighthood in this irresistible comic book.

HERE’S HOW TO PLAY:
• Select your character and begin your quest.
• Numbers are hidden in every panel. Decide where you want to go next, and then flip to the panel with the matching number.
• Solve puzzles and collect bravery bracelets in your quest for success.
• If you fail your mission, just start again from the beginning! You can play the book again and again, making different choices every time.

Remember, this is no ordinary comic book—what happens next is up to you!

boardgame.name: Knights Club: The Message of Destiny
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a medieval age of chivalry and sorcery, you’ve been training hard to become a knight. Now the king has a mission for you: carry a message of the utmost importance to the leader of a neighboring country. But traps and enemies will be numerous on your route! Forge your weapons to make them more powerful, win points collecting magical cards, be victorious in battle, and advance through the levels to become strong enough to bring your mission to a successful end.

HERE’S HOW TO PLAY:
• To begin your quest, select your character.
• Numbers are hidden in every panel. Decide where you want to go next, and then flip to the panel with the matching number.
• Solve puzzles, collect supplies, and defeat enemies in your quest for success. If you succeed, you may be knighted!
• If your mission fails, just start again at the beginning! You can play the book over and over again, making different choices every time.

Remember, this is no ordinary comic book—what happens next is up to you!

boardgame.name: Knights Club: The Buried City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After years of dedicated training and adventure, you are finally a full-fledged knight! You are sent on your first official mission by Elliot, a famous merchant. Impressed by your strength and skill, Elliot entrusts you with the search for a list of precious objects, all hidden on a distant island. Can you find all the objects and bring them back? Can you even return alive from this treacherous and mysterious island? Your success depends on your choices alone, because the hero is you!

HERE’S HOW TO PLAY:
• To begin your quest, select your character.
• Numbers are hidden in every panel. Decide where you want to go next, and then flip to the panel with the matching number.
• Solve puzzles, collect supplies, and defeat enemies in your quest for success.
• If your mission fails, just start again at the beginning! You can play the book over and over again, making different choices every time.

Remember, this is no ordinary comic book—what happens next is up to you!

boardgame.name: Iron Magicians: The Search for the Magic Crystals
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Step inside a steampunk re-imagining of nineteenth-century Paris, where magic and machines exist in harmony. The Eiffel Tower—a secret weapon built with magic—is almost complete, but the crystals that power the structure are missing! Find the hidden crystals and survive your dangerous mission.

HERE’S HOW TO PLAY:
• Select your character and begin your quest.
• Numbers are hidden in every panel. Decide where you want to go next, and then flip to the panel with the matching number.
• Solve puzzles, cast spells, and defeat enemies in your quest for success. Only after you’ve collected all the crystals will your journey be complete.
• If you fail your mission, just start again from the beginning! You can play the book again and again, making different choices every time.

Remember, this is no ordinary comic book—what happens next is up to you!

boardgame.name: Durch Kampf zum Sieg
boardgame.description:
Whole title: "Durch Kampf zum Sieg, Original-Hakenkreuz-Gesellschaftsspiel“ (eng. "Through struggle to victory, Original swastika parlor game") made by Verlag August Haug, Berlin.

Game rules similar to game "Mensch ärgere dich nicht!", which is German version of Pachisi. Each player has a set of pawns that start in his or her corner of the board (this game is unique because the game boards layout is similar to swastika). The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

boardgame.name: Dream Home: Promo tokens – #Shelfie
boardgame.description:
These are 'Shelfie' promo tokens for the game Dream Home. The first player to complete a three-card Living Room receives the 'board games bookshelf' promo token, which is worth 2 points. The second player with three card Living Room receives the 'board games shelf' promo token, which is worth 1 point.

The promo token is treated as every other furnishing token.

listing.notes:
NEW - unpunched
Check out my other items and bundle and save on shipping.

boardgame.name: Behemoth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Behemoths are massive creatures that generally dwell in swamp-like areas, but have recently begun to expand around the world into less temperate climates. The appearance of the Behemoth has been widely debated in its source material; as they all have slightly different characteristics, however, the one thing that documentarians agree on is the massive size of the creature.

boardgame.name: Titan: It came from below!
boardgame.description:
It Came From Below is an expansion for Titan that introduces a resident extra-terrestrial! Miners will have to deal with the Alien as it moves around the crater, performing a variety of helpful or disruptive acts.
Each turn, players will have the option of controlling the Alien and using its powers. However, exactly what it does is determined randomly at the start of each game, and how you choose to use it is up to you...

It Came From Below! brings new extraterrestrial elements to Titan which open up a wealth of strategic possibilities! Each turn, the active player will have the option of activating and controlling the Alien by performing a certain trigger action. They will then be able to move and act with it, using it as they see fit. As well as having its own specific power to use, the Alien can spawn Sprogs onto Rigs it is present on, which will interact with them in a variety of ways.

The expansion also introduces a new Rig type; Alien Pools; which produce their own mysterious resource called Alien Crystals.

The Alien itself and all of its related elements each have unique effects which are determined by the Alien Tableau. This Tableau is made up of the Alien tiles, which are drawn randomly at the start of the game.

The Brain Tile determines when the Alien is “Activated”, meaning the triggering action that a player must perform in order to be able to use it.
The Tentacle Tile determines the Alien’s special ability, which it can perform as an Action.

The Sprog Tile determines the effect of Alien Sprogs when they are spawned onto a Rig.

The Crystal Tile determines the properties of Alien Crystal Resources.

There are 5 tiles of each type, and the random generation of the Alien Tableau means that you’ll rarely come up against the same Alien twice! The effects can be good or bad, so you’ll have the choice of using the Alien to your own benefit, or turning it against your opponents...

boardgame.name: Titan: Starbot
boardgame.description:
Starbot is a Solo/AI mode for TITAN. Whether you’re searching for a challenging solo experience or just want to add another player to your game, Starbot’s rules and behaviour remain the same.

This top of the line automaton specialises in mining operations and has just touched down in Titan’s mining crater alongside you. It has been programmed to extract as much Deuterium as possible and to avoid polluting its ship’s Hold with Tholins. It will not be involved in extracting standard resources or in
meeting corporate Objectives. All Starbot cares about is Credits, and it will do anything it can to obtain as many as possible! It controls ultra-mobile Drones, expands its network efficiently and takes control of Rigs in the blink of an eye.
Starbot is a new kind of opponent and your results won’t only affect the STARDRILL™ bottom line, but also the future of all human TITAN workers in future mining operations.

Starbot includes 6 different AIs, represented by their own individual Command Boards. Each version provides a challenging experience in their own way!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – The GiftForge Insert
boardgame.description:
Tested with premium sleeved cards.
This product does not require assembly.

Insert size: 36,2 cm x 26,2 cm x 18 cm.
The product won't lift the lid.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – Elemental Pack

boardgame.name: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – The GiftForge Card and map tile holders
boardgame.description:
Tested with premium sleeved cards.
This product does not require assembly.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – Elemental Pack

boardgame.name: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – The GiftForge Token holders
boardgame.description:
This product does not require assembly.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.

boardgame.name: Titan: For Science!
boardgame.description:
For Science! introduces a 6th type of Rig to your games of Titan: Science Rigs! These new installations function mostly like normal Rigs - they can be added to your Network and activated as per the normal rules. However each time they’re activated, instead of generating a resource, they allow you to use the special powers shown on the Research Board. New technologies become available each time a Science Rig or Science Module is placed on the board. The more of these you unlock, the more powerful and versatile the Rigs become, but beware - each new power you unlock becomes available to other players too!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – The GiftForge Tile holders
boardgame.description:
This product does not require assembly.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – Elemental Pack

boardgame.name: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – The GiftForge Other components holders
boardgame.description:
This product does not require assembly.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – Elemental Pack

boardgame.name: Encounters - Volume VI: Wilderness Crossroads
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Always be Vigil in the Wilderness

A mysterious tree that sings a sorrowful song of death. Servants of the witch hunting for poor souls in a dark forest. Dwarves looking for an axe of an ancient king. A ghost that cannot go to the afterlife. The wilderness hides a lot of secrets… will you dare to find all of them?

This encounter pack contains 10 carefully designed wilderness-themed encounters, with monster tactics, leads, hooks, and new monsters, items, and spells to spice up your game. Easy to use and drop into any adventure–to fill up blanks on the map, make a long journey more interesting or kickstart another adventure. Every step can be your last, so beware!

boardgame.name: Titan: The E-Team
boardgame.description:
Expand your operations with this 5th player expansion which takes Titan’s levels of player interaction even further. The race intensifies with the arrival of an additional competitor as you compete to be the first to complete Objectives, fulfil Planetary Orders, exploit Rigs and reach Titan’s treasure filled core…

Includes everything you need to play with a 5th player!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Barbarian Primal Path: Path of the Hollow Self
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although many barbarians draw power from the world of spirits through their use of primal totems or unwavering devotion to an ancestral tradition, some embrace a more dangerous path. During a rage, barbarians who follow the Path of the Hollow Self leave their bodies empty vessels open to any wrathful or malevolent spirits who may find it. These fugues rely upon necromantic powers that even the most accomplished of arcane masters may dismiss as too dangerous, as there is little way to tell what nightmarish forces may rally when a strong new body presents itself to the void.

Expanding upon the mechanics of the 5E Barbarian class, this PDF allows you to create occultist barbarians who embrace the influence of wayward ghosts during their rages.

boardgame.name: One Page Adventure: Deep Gnome's Cache
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Robberies like this have never been seen before. The building, completely cleared of its wealth before it sinks into the earth itself. It isn't clear exactly how this is done, but people need answers (and hopefully their money back).

One Page Adventure: Deep Gnome's Cache contains:

A short adventure for level 1 characters
An HD dungeon map
An Adventure Seed
A new Poison

boardgame.name: Species of the Multiverse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From Oz to Zikkaria and Everything in Between!

This supplement contains 46 species and 98 subspecies drawn from across the multiverse, ranging from Atlantis to ancient Greece, from the time of the Vikings to the fairyland of Oz, from the fantasy world of Zikkaria campaigns to the gothic realms of the Uberwald.

Every core species is covered, including three dragonborn, five dwarf, seven elf, five gnome, one half-elf, three half-orc, nine halfling, eight human, and one tiefling subspecies. More exotic species are covered with accompanying subspecies, including monstrous catfolk, centaurs, fairies, gorgons, minotaurs, nymphs, ogres, and panes.

There's also dozens of new species, including amazons, anutherites, arimaspi, blankfolk, cabiri, cecrops, chronons, deep ones, dhampirs, diamoraks, draemons, equus, golemkin, hyperboreans, ippei, jekylls, lycans, mangaboos, mofolk, monkeyfolk, myrmidons, ozbeasts, powderborn, regenerons, sirens, twi, undying, unseen, and woggle-bugs.

boardgame.name: Factbook: Albenistan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From publisher blurb:

This Factbook provides more information on the fictional country for use with adventures published by Sword’s Edge Publishing. It updates the situation in Albenistan to 2022, changing the circumstances related in the d20 Modern Albenistan Series — Raid on Ashkashem, the Qalashar Device, the Khorforjan Gambit, and Election Day.

The main presentation is provided in the style of the World Factbook, but also includes a summary brief and open source reporting that can be presented to players interested in more information.

boardgame.name: Tupolev Tu 10 Boomslang Armed Transport
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originally intended as an armed freighter with the ability to carry external cargo, the Tu 10 Boomslang became an effective small warship. It retains huge cargo carrying ability, but can also function as an escort.

The PCs are asked whether they can use this ship to pursue pirates that have just jumped out of the system. The ship is on a flight test and does not have a combat crew, only technicians from the shipyard. The rewards are great, but will the ship have some undiagnosed problem that will cause it to lock up at a critical moment?

This supplement includes details of the Boomslang, A3 deck plans of the interior, an adventure called Scratch Crew and a list of pirate NPCs. There’s details of an armed Subsidised merchant included too.

boardgame.name: Perils of the Innocent (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team is hired for an emergency mission to rescue a dissident's baby from a corporate biolab. Can the heroes reunite mother and daughter, even though the corporation thinks the child's DNA is special enough to warrant kidnapping and murder?

Perils of the Innocent is a cyberpunk adventure set in the near future. The plot involves an emergency mission to rescue a dissident's baby from a corporate biolab.
boardgame.rpgsetting: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America

boardgame.name: Breakforcist
boardgame.description:
Publishers description***




Enjoy the chaotic & addictive arcade action of the world’s first breakfast/exorcism themed brick-breaker!

Use your magical ball & paddle to save breakfast from the clutches of the evil demon “Howdy” through endless waves of possessed waffles! A fresh take on an old-school game genre.

boardgame.name: Ruin of Bleak Hill (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mottled Spire’s wild, rugged uplands lie beyond the Selka River. Crumbling ruins and abandoned mines—the leavings of civilisation’s ebbing tide—dot the hills. One such place is the isolated wind-blasted ruin of Bleak Hill Manor. Here once dwelled the wizard-sage Ilmatar Tiera before her untimely death at unknown hands. The centuried ruin—decayed and crumbled—has alternately lain abandoned or served as the lair of marauders, bandits and worse. Now, however, events conspire to focus certain interested parties upon the ruin, and all such folk are in need of adventurers brave enough to dare the terrors of the Mottled Spire.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Ashlar campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial: Light Years From Home Game
boardgame.description:
E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial: Light Years From Home Game is a co-operative game in which you play as Elliot, Gertie, Mike, or Greg as they try to find parts for E.T. to create a communication device to contact his home planet. You race around the neighborhood using ramps and shortcuts to avoid federal agents bent on capturing E.T. To win, you must find all the parts of the device and get E.T. to the clearing when the mothership arrives to pick him up.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Millenia Cave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep within a forest lies a hidden cave that has seen plenty of use over the centuries. Dwarven miners, drow raiding parties, power-seeking necromancers, and settlers have all used it to their various ends. Recently, a ring of smugglers has been using a hidden passage in the cave to bypass military checkpoints and sell their ill-gotten gains.

A few residents of the nearby town called Willowshire came a little too close to discovering the operation, forcing the smugglers to kidnap them. This act prompted intense disagreement between one of the smugglers and his cohorts, fracturing the group. He now wants the operation to end but spare some of his friends. The military wants to stop to their criminal activity and restore order, and the townsfolk are concerned about their missing community members.

The Millenia Cave is a fifth-edition compatible adventure for the world's most popular roleplaying game designed for a party of four to six level-four characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: The Velvet Fists
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within a harmless guild for servants and the like sit monsters upon high thrones. An intricate web of criminal activities is being conducted right under the city’s nose — and feet — and no one is any the wiser. The party has been dumped head first into the complex system of lies and victims weaved together by the Velvet Fists, and only one thing is clear: many lives will be lost today… but whose?

The Velvet Fists is a fifth-edition compatible adventure for the world's greatest roleplaying game designed for a party of four to six level-ten characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: The Tower of the Mad Wizard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a land as unforgiving as Azeron, destruction and despair wait around every corner. A wizard named Edurnas discovered this when he found himself trapped there after being defeated by a powerful entity, Gormorthos. And now a party of adventures find themselves trapped in that realm as well. Edurnas may play a key role in their journey through this Azeron, but trust isn’t gained easily in that land. Should the party make poor choices when confronting the wizard, their failure to gain Edurnas as an ally may prove a pivotal point in whether they defeat Gormorthos, as well as gain their freedom from Azeron.

The Tower of the Mad Wizard is a fifth-edition compatible adventure for the world's most popular roleplaying game designed for a party of four to six level-eight characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: The Beholden Temple
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Beholden Temple is a D&D fifth-edition compatible adventure designed for a party of four level-three characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

A necromancer, Malek Fargazer, and a group of cultists, all worshippers of Orcus, are attempting to summon their god-figure into the body of a flesh golem. The cultists believe that if they summon Orcus, he will begin his reign on the prime material plane and reward them.

In order to summon Orcus, Malek is siphoning the memories of townsfolk from a nearby settlement to fuel the magic of an ancient Necronomicon. Undead, raised by the cultists,
capture the nearby townsfolk. They are then brought to the Beholden Temple, which used to be the temple of The God of Guardians. Here the majority of their memories are wiped, and they are almost always released.

boardgame.name: The Frozen Temple
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Frozen Temple is a D&D fifth-edition compatible adventure designed for a party of four to six level-one characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

A large, white-furred creature has been terrorizing the ice fishermen of Fjollum, a town in the Mirror Mountains. The fishermen refer to the creature as the “snow devil” and are terrified to go out on the ice of Red Lake to fish for fear of encountering the monster. This is threatening the livelihood and food stores of the town, which relies heavily on fish for both food and trade. Consequently, the leader of the community, Sigdis Linadottir, has put out word to the surrounding region that the town is looking for help getting rid of the snow devil.

This snow devil dwells in the Frozen Temple, an ancient temple not too far from Fjollum that the villagers know of but stay clear of. They believe it was dedicated to an ancient deity of cold named Hjort, and the villagers fear disturbing whatever may reside there now. The snow devil leaves the temple to hunt, and recently game has become scarce, forcing it to consider the villages of Fjollum as potential prey, though it hasn’t attacked any of them yet.

Besides being the lair of the snow devil, the Frozen Temple contains ice creatures, remnants of the days the temple was active. Several arctic nomads have also taken up residence in the entry hall, though they haven’t dared to explore more of the temple.

boardgame.name: The Oracle of Shadows
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oracle of Shadows is a D&D fifth-edition compatible one-shot adventure designed for a party of four to six level-ten characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

The characters recently escaped from an incursion into a lich’s tomb, barely getting away with their lives. However, shortly thereafter, they discovered that a powerful curse had been placed on them all, slowly causing them to slip into the realm of undeath.

Unable to find a cure anywhere else, they have decided to seek out the Oracle of Shadows, a powerful being said to be able to read the future from one’s shadow. They believe that the oracle will be able to read their futures and see what might cure them. It is rumored, though, that a series of trials must be passed by any who would seek an audience with the oracle.

And thus, the characters find themselves trudging through the Croaking Swamp toward Mount Shadow where the Oracle is said to dwell.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Restless
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tomb of the Restless is a D&D fifth-edition compatible adventure designed for a party of four to six level-seven characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

After years of research and countless endeavors, a local farmer has finally found what he believes will revive the public’s love for the perfect beverage his late third-greatgrandfather invented. With the party’s help, he may be able to accomplish his life-long goal. However, many individuals in the town have warned that a great danger awaits them there, deep within those tunnels.

boardgame.name: Truffle Kerfluffle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Truffle Kerfluffle is a D&D fifth-edition compatible adventure designed for a party of four to six level 1 characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

Deep within a forest, hidden away from even the bright rays of the sun, rests a small village full of burrows known as Dahish. In these burrows live a community of gnomes who worship the forest deity Baervan Wildwanderer. The village’s prominent feature is usually the massive mushroom grove that grows nearby, acting as the gnomes’ supply of food, medicine, trade, and even light. Recently, however, the mushrooms in the grove have begun literally growing legs and walking away, even attacking some of the gnomes in the village and nearby fauna.

Dahish isn’t the only settlement that has been affected by this strange occurrence, though. As it turns out, the lord of a small kingdom that is Dahish’s closest trade relationship has a particular craving for the mushrooms that are supplied by Dahish. With the grove rapidly disappearing, the mushroom trade has been cut off, as the gnomes of Dahish need all they have to survive. Lord Dansworth Ratheem, the lord of the small kingdom, is willing to pay a pretty copper for any issues that are occurring to be resolved, allowing the mushroom trade to be re-opened.

Unbeknownst to either the village of Dahish or Lord Dansworth, White Cap Village, a trufflid settlement that resides not far away, is the root of their troubles. Recently, a few of the trufflids who were out exploring the surrounding area uncovered a relic of the demonic Fungal Queen and brought it back to their village. The relic, once unearthed, began to spread the evil influence of the Fungal Queen throughout the forest. Compelled by the forces within the relic, the trufflids and verdamites that live within the surrounding area have fervently worshipped her since.

As the influence of the Fungal Queen spreads throughout the forest, more and more plants come alive and attack any creatures they come across. The relic must be neutralized or destroyed to end the threat to the forest and the settlements that rely on it.

boardgame.name: Frostblight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Frostblight is a D&D fifth-edition compatible adventure designed for a party of four to six level-nineteen characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

A dark deity has been summoned to the Material Plane and threatens all life. Characters will delve deep into her lair, the Cave of Ice and Thunder, to uncover the mysteries of the Pengu and stop her from destroying the Material Plane.

boardgame.name: Ambushes & Avalanches
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ambushes & Avalanches is a D&D fifth-edition compatible adventure designed for a party of four to six level-four characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

The ice troll Frostbeard has discovered the Veil of Winter, an ancient artifact dedicated to the deity of frost, and is using it to expand the icy domain of the Azure Spine Glacier. This is causing frigid air to roll down from the Morrow Peak mountains into surrounding villages and towns. This is not only affecting the inhabitants of those towns, but also disrupted trade routes in the region. Inhabitants in the area believe another ice age is upon them and are seeking someone to stop it.

boardgame.name: Demons Below?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hideous creatures, suspected to be demons, have been spotted in the countryside, and the adventuring party—shall we call them heroes?—has been tasked with finding the source of the demonic incursion and putting an end to it before bad things start happening. Because no one wants that, right?

This D&D 5e adventure is designed for a party of four PCs levels 1 through 4.

boardgame.name: Into the Darkness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventuring party has traveled to a dank, foul dungeon -- aren’t all dungeons dank and foul after all? -- on a quest to recover a noble family’s heirloom, a wooden music box.

In this D&D 5e adventure, players will encounter different factions at odds with each other: a green hag, duergar, and vampires. It is up to them to decide which factions they will aid and which they will betray on the way to recovering the heirloom.

The adventure is designed for a party of four level-six PCs.

boardgame.name: Fishy Business
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fishy Business is a D&D fifth-edition compatible adventure designed for a party of four to six characters of levels 1 to 4. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

A friendly aarakocra fishing village rests on Windy Peak, a quaint mountain that is usually uneventful. The fishermen there provide food and trade for the village through the plentiful source of fish that they harvest from a lake not far away. Recently, however, the fish population has started to drastically decrease with no apparent cause.

The aarakocra elder of the village knows that if this issue continues, his people will starve. Thus, he is on the lookout for an adventuring party—or anyone, for that matter—who will investigate the cause of the declining fish population and put an end to it. He has sent word with Camellia, a traveling tea merchant who frequently rests in their fishing lodge, hoping she can find someone who will help them during her travels.

Unbeknownst to the village, a group of sahuagin that call themselves the Children of the Deep Father now resides somewhere deep within the depths of Windy Peak. They are a fanatical group who worship an aboleth that dwells below the mountain. Not only are they eating fish faster than they can repopulate, but they’re also using them as sacrifices to their aboleth deity.

boardgame.name: Funkoverse Strategy Game: Universal Monsters 100
boardgame.description:
Face off in the ultimate Pop! battle! Combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in four exciting game scenarios. Move through memorable locations — Dracula’s Castle or Frankenstein’s Laboratory — and use your characters’ unique abilities to capture points and achieve victory!

—description from the publisher

Face off in the ultimate Pop! battle! Combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in four exciting game scenarios. Move through memorable locations – Mermaid Lagoon or The Jolly Roger – and use your characters’ unique abilities to capture points and achieve victory!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chemical Overload
boardgame.description:
In Chemical Overload young alchemists are training to create potions to impress King. To create a potion, you must first of course purchase an empty flask of the correct size, then by combining and adding the correct chemical combination players will create magical potions. These potions all have various effects and victory point values. Whenever a pile is empty, a Toxin effect is revealed, these toxins will add an end game trigger to the game, once enough toxin cards are exposed and an end condition is met, the lab has become to toxic with chemicals and all alchemists must leave thus ending the game. The player with the most Victory points wins the game!

This game is a Deck Building game where some cards remain in your hand and some are tabled for ongoing effects. Flasks remain on the table until used. When a player adds chemicals to the flask and creates a new potion, all chemicals, the flask, and the new potion are placed in the discard pile.

The game included hundreds of cards, various coin tokens and various Victory point tokens. With hundreds of card combinations, no two games are alike!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Daemonium Venatrix
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sister Nadia thought she was ready.

The Order had trained her in the real Rite of Exorcism (not the fake one spread by the Church to prevent its abuse), and they had bound Elliot to a chair and locked the door from the inside. Together with her Sisters, they had acquired Elliot’s three ancorae: a bottle of expensive whiskey for his Pain, a framed photo of his deceased husband for his Regret, and a Pride flag for his Passion.

She began the rite and the other sisters joined in. “In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti, amen. Exurgat Deus et dissipentur inimici ejus....” She looked down at Elliot, his body slumped forward and held only by the ropes, and felt pity. If this rite did not work, Elliot’s soul would be destroyed and the demon inside would grow more powerful.

boardgame.name: 10 Million HP Planet
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

your friends. Every ocean became a crushing fist smashed against the cities of the world, and every volcano was a loaded gun pointed right at a cowering humanity. You and your buds are heroes. Super powered beings with near godlike powers. You’re wizards who have unlocked the secrets of the universe, martial artists who can control every atom in their body, and genius inventors who’ve broken the limits of science. And you’re gonna kick the planets arse for killing everyone you’ve ever met.

But you have a dark secret.

You know why it happened.

Maybe you are why it happened.

Play to find out.

boardgame.name: A... B... C... D... SPEEDY
boardgame.description:
Play the classic, very popular and addictive game, but with a literal twist!
Get rid of the cards by putting down cards with identical first or last letters.
Do you think it’s easy?!
Try doing it while competing rapidly…
ABCD SPEEDY is an entertaining, fast-paced game to learn the English language by practicing reading, quick letter identification, and increasing your vocabulary at the same time.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Friendship Effort Victory
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Join the fray in Friendship, Effort, Victory, a shonen battle manga tabletop roleplaying game. Inspired by works such as Bleach, One Piece, Naruto, My Hero Academia, and other battle manga, Friendship, Effort, Victory uses the acclaimed Powered By The Apocalypse Engine to deliver the flashy, dynamic battles and intense, climatic drama of those sensational works.

boardgame.name: Anaqwald
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Anaqwald is a short trip into a subarctic bog deep in the hinterlands. Twisted spruce and stately birch surround white meadows that hide an endless void of peat and muck. But in the center of the bog, a light can be seen. A rustic lodge, clad in black wood beckons...
boardgame.rpgseries: The Cold and Deathless Northern Darkness Jam Submissions

boardgame.name: Goblin Firework Fight
boardgame.description:
Goblins have come to the town of Sandpoint, intent upon stealing their fireworks for an upcoming festival. Do you have the goblin grit to pillage your way to victory and emerge from the town with the most fireworks?

The game is played over a number of rounds. Each round, every goblin takes a turn pulling a loot token from the town's treasure pile. These tokens might represent useful tools or valuable treasure like fireworks, dogslicers (goblin knives), or shields. Unfortunately, the tribe's most fearsome beast, a pig called Squealy Nord, is also hiding in the treasure, bringing mayhem and chaos to any who draw his token from the pile. You never know what you might get.

Fighty goblins can choose dogslicers and just steal from their neighbors instead of raiding the village. Smart goblins will take some shields to defend themselves from their peers. Crafty goblins with leadership qualities may choose instead to take the badge of leadership, the Pickle Token, signifying for all their prominence and importance as well as the right to pick first next time.

After 10 rounds and one last free for all opportunity to steal from each other on the way back home, one goblin is declared the "bestest goblin of the raid" and basks in glory and the admiration of their peers. Until the next raid...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sembia Origins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Los Umbra han vuelto a Faerûn con la intención de reconstruir su imperio. La ciudad de Derlun se ve amenazada por el retorno de los netherinos en mitad de una gran confrontación interna por la toma del poder. Es la misión de los jugadores mantener el orden en la ciudad al mismo tiempo que la protegen de la sombra.

Esta es una historia para D&D que proporciona todo lo que necesitas para jugar los tres primeros niveles de una partida con un gran telón de fondo. Enemigos, aliados, familias enfrentadas, lugares de Derlun, todo viene descrito en el interior de este manual de campaña que puedes ir completando gracias a las actualizaciones del mismo. Sembia Origins cuenta con algunas reglas alternativas y proporciona sugerencias para que tú mismo completes la aventura.

boardgame.name: 914 Año del Reino
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

No miréis a los cielos, ni siquiera a las profundidades inferiores, ni incluso en la lejanía del pasado o del futuro. Buscad la divinidad en el interior, ya que la sangre es la vida y en su llamada podrán ser escuchadas las promesas de la vida eterna, una vez hayan sido escuchadas.

– seguidor de la Sangre de Vol


Esta aventura está diseñada para cuatro personajes de nivel 7. Con pequeños ajustes la aventura puede jugarse con grupos más pequeños o más grandes de jugadores. Esta aventura está centrada en el año 914 AR (Año del Reino) en el imperio de Thrane. La aventura asume que todos, o la gran mayoría de los jugadores, son miembros de la Iglesia de la Llama de Plata.

boardgame.name: Brechas en Graywall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Esta aventura se centra en la fortaleza de Orcbone. La aventura está planteada de una manera abierta y no sigue un guión lineal. Es una aventura basada en una serie de localizaciones y de sucesos que transcurren en el tiempo.

boardgame.name: Border Watch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

La guerra ha finalizado... pero no para Iuz.

Detrás de sus nuevas tierras conquistadas, Iuz trama un plan para golpear el verdadero corazón de Furyondia.Lo que empieza para los personajes como una simple asignación a una fortaleza en la frontera, la trama se transforma en una aventura de guerra, espionaje, e intriga que podría sacudir a la nación entera a sus más altos niveles.

Esta aventura, diseñada para cuatro personajes de nivel 3, tiene lugar en las tierras fronterizas del territorio entre Iuz y Furyondia, tras la estela de las recientes guerras de Falcongris.

User summary:

A Spanish-language translation of WGM1: Border Watch, which apparently is unlicensed.

boardgame.name: El Legado Robado - Parte I
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Primera Aventura de nivel 1 de la saga "El Legado Robado" para el Escenario de Campaña "Las Tierras Yegimales".

From the back of the book:

Ningún gnomo del pueblo de Núbelon pensaría jamás que los monjes que viven en armonía en el Gran Páramo podrían ser atacados alguna vez, y menos aún, por una banda de ladrones de pergaminos. La esperanza de los monjes se ha depositado en el joven Loy-yang, el monje más joven de templo. ¿Pero qué se esconde detrás de estos robos de pergaminos? ¿Por qué los han robado? ¿Quiénes son realmente estos saqueadores de pergaminos?

User summary:

The PDF scenario is distributed with multiple image and map files (JPG format).
